P. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 1.700.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  P. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  P. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Angel Medardo

texts.en:
Angel Medardo B. G. is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Angel is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Angel also works in agriculture and raises pigs and chickens. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Angel plans to use the credit to grow corn and the maracuya fruit. He believes that the loan will help him become more productive in agriculture. His dream is to have his own house. 

After work he likes to play sports.

loans.use: To grow corn and maracuya fruit

loans.name: Yerlin José

texts.es: El Sr. Yerlin M. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  dos años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado dos créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para resolver necesidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Yerlin M. is from the town of El Sauce. He has worked as a Municipal Security Guard for two years. He has had two Ceprodel loans for personal expenses. This loan is to cover some household needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay household expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg D. is a 46 years old widow who lives with her son in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her son live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. Her son currently works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Erdenechimeg operates a business where she sews traditional Mongolian clothes such as deels, or long coats in her home. She began her business in 2004 and has since then has built a stable operation. She sews a wide variety of deels which can be worn throughout the year according to her customers' specifications. She charges between 80,000 and 120,000 MNT including material cost and 35,000-50,000 MNT without material cost. Her monthly revenue is 600,000 MNT. She produces all her clothes with nice quality therefore, she always has a high demand for her clothes. 

Erdenechimeg is a very honest, helpful and hardworking woman and is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan so that she can purchase more fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary T. (in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Vibol Chan, have been married since 1999 and have two sons. Both of them are in school. They live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Mary T. has been a tailor for more than three years. Her husband has been driving a motor Remorque for more than one year. (A Remorque is a motorbike attached to a trailer at the back). Besides the businesses, the couple grows rice as well. 

Mary has requested a Kiva loan twice already. She is now is asking for her third loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She also will use a part of her loan to buy a new motorbike because the old one breaks down and does not work well.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and replace her old motorbike.

loans.name: Twelwaneku Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
G. Betty’s ten-year-old beauty salon and hairdressing enterprise is one she speaks of in the highest and most glowing of terms. The business has been indispensable in making ends meet. Her business generates a weekly income of 50,000 UGX. Betty undertook apprentice training at a local salon and this molded her into the beautician that she is today.
Betty is happily married with five children. Casting her mind back, she says her first business experience was in a farming enterprise.
With this loan, she will purchase more hair chemicals for her salon business. Betty belongs to Twelwaneku Development group-Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase more hair chemicals for her salon business

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and clothing.

He has operated his boutique business for the past six years, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Said faces a major challenge of seasonality. During holiday season, the demand for clothes is high compared to when schools have opened, the demand for clothes is low. He hopes to expand and become a big supplier of clothes to other boutiques in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000, he wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, es casada y reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Sialupe Baca, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de chicha de jora, la chicha es una bebida tradicional de varias zonas del país cuya preparación se viene realizando desde tiempos ancestrales, consiste en una bebida fermentada en vasijas de barro cocido, hecha a base de una harina de maíz especial denominada jora. Esta bebida es bastante consumida en actividades sociales, además los pobladores de la zona la consumen a diario ya que creen que les brinda fuerzas para salir a trabajar.

Carmen prepara la chicha en su casa y la ofrece en venta a los vecinos de su localidad. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo de la mejor forma posible. Actualmente ella desea adquirir más insumos como harina y leña para ampliar su producción, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, married, and lives with her family in Sialupe Baca, a rural area of the Lambayeque district located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes and sells chicha of jora which is a traditional drink that in various areas has been prepared since ancestral times. It consists of a drink fermented in baked clay pots. The main ingredient is a special cornflour called jora. This beverage is drunk a lot at social activities. In addition the people of the area drink it daily since they believe it offers them strength to continue working.

Carmen prepares the chicha in her home and sells it to neighbors in her area. The business is an important means of income to her family which is why she always does her best. At the moment she wants to acquire more materials such as corn flour and fire wood to increase her production, which is why she is requesting from Edpyme Alternative a 500 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy more materials such as corn flour and fire wood to increase her production.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria Margarita de 42 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 12 y el otro de 8 años, ambos estudiando la secundaria y primaria, labora para el MINSA desempeñandose como Enfermera Especial responsable de la zona # 3 de Juigalpa, con 19 años de servicio, con sus creditos ha logrado dar mejores condiciones a su casa y gracias al aopoyo de KIVA con el credito anterior logro construir el cuarto de su hijo mayor. 

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de construir ahora el baño en su casa, acondicionandolo con el lavamanos, el inodoro, y ponerle azulejos y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 42.  She is married and has two children, 8 and 12, who are in primary and secondary school, respectively.  She has worked as a Special Nurse in Juigalpa for 19 years.  Previous loans have allowed her to improve her house, and she is grateful to Kiva for the loan she used to built her older son's bedroom.

She is asking for her eighth loan so that she can build a bathroom, with a sink, toilet, and tiling, so that she can continue to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 38-year-old married man with three children living in a rented  house in Fort Portal. Uganda, with a desire to build his own home in the next three years. 

He has been working in the retail trade for seven years now and the business is still profitable amidst challenges, such as limited finances to meet customer demands. Jimmy needs the credit  to buy soft drinks, rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, rice and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 28 años es un hombre trabajador que siempre le ha gustado ser muy responsable con su familia por eso comenzó a buscar trabajo y pesar de la falta de oportunidades comenzó a trabajar como taxista. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana esta actualmente trabajado en un taxi privado ya que poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación obtuvo clientela para poder mantener a su familia. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00pm. Aunque a pesar que la delincuencia está creciendo y es más peligroso salir con el carro el sigue trabajando para generar dinero. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere seguir trabajando y darle un buen vivir a su familia por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento y bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28, is a hard worker that has always liked being responsible for his family.  For that reason he started to look for work despite the lack of opportunities.  He began working as a cab driver.

He lives in a suburban area and is currently works driving a private taxi, and with work and dedication has obtained a clientele in order to support his family.  He works from 6:00am until 10:00pm.  Even though crime is on the rise and it's more dangerous to go out with the car he continues working in order to generate money.

He has many aspirations for the future, and so wants to keep working and give a good life to his family.  That's why he wants the loan to buy construction materials like cement and bricks.  He eventually wants to finish building his house.

loans.use: Cement, bricks

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Alicia M., 53, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for herself and her family. She finished a two-year secretarial course and is a proud mother of two children who are now in high school and elementary school. She is a single mother and gives all her best as a variety store owner to sustain their living. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Alicia presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store that caters to needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocery in the community. Alicia has operated from home for five years now, and has gained regular customers who keep her business alive. She employs no one, and earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

Because her goal is to level up her business, she decided to borrow 27,000 PHP. She will use this to buy goods that her customers prefer. She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make hers their number one sari-sari store in the community.

Alicia has learned the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate hers. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goal she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled.

As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Additional stock for her variety store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her bigest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a cereals selling business for the past two years.  She runs a shop and sells to her neighbors and passersby. Jane faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she will purchase beans and maize for sale. She decided to join Yehu, to access loans which will improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Santos Eduviges

texts.es:
S. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en San Simón, departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo quien es discapacitado y se moviliza en silla D. ruedas y sus hijos: Marta D. 23 años, Francis D. 21, Marlon D. 18, Immer D. 17, Erick D. 15 y Jerson D. 12 años D. edad, todos son dependientes.
S. tiene 5 años D. dedicarse a una tienda la cual inicio por la necesidad D. tener ingresos económicos para ayudar a sus hijos con los alimentos, la educación y salud, su horario D. venta es D. 6:00am a 6:00pm. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería como azúcar, frijol, gas, bebidas y productos plásticos. Con esta ayuda espera mejorar la condición D. su negocio y atender mejor a los clientes.
Su objetivo es luchar por su negocio, ya que es su fuente estable D. ingresos y del cual su familia depenD..
texts.en:
S. is 39 years of age and resides in San Simón, a department of Morazán. She lives with her husband who has a disability and requires a wheelchair, as well as her children: Marta (23), Francis (21), Marlon (18), Immer (17), Erick (15) and Jerson (12), all of whom are economically dependent on her.

S. has worked in her store for five years. She started running this business out of economic necessity to help proviD. for the food, education and health of her children. She works from 6:00am to 6:00pm. S. is currently requesting a loan to purchase merchandise including sugar, beans, gas, beverages and plastic products. With this assistance she hopes to improve the conditions of her store and better attend to her customers. Her goal is to fight for her business as it is a stable source of income which her family depend on.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise including sugar, beans, gas, beverages and plastic products.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Departamento D. San Martín. Marina es contadora D. profesión y negociante D. vocación, es viuda, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, todos independientes.

Su esfuerzo motivador y las ganas D. salir adelante, hicieron que buscara la forma D. generarce otros ingresos, iniciando su negocio D. venta D. pollos al por menor, negocio que tiene hace máss D. 5 años.  Ella tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado cercano a su casa.

Con este préstamo D. S/3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará  pollos vivos en jabas para poder continuar abasteciendo a su fiel y frecuente clientela.

Marina es una mujer muy independiente, segura y decidida.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y mujer.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” ["Our Lady of Peace"] communal bank, of the District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. Marina is an accountant by profession and works as a merchant. She is a widow, 55 years old, and the mother of 6 children, all of them independent. 

Her motivated efforts and her desire to get ahead led her to seek a way to generate additional income. She started her enterprise selling chickens on a retail basis, a business she has operated for more than 5 years. She has a small stall in a market near her home. 

With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian new soles, she will buy live chickens in sacks so that she can continue supplying her loyal and frequent customers. 

Marina is a very independent, decisive and self-assured woman. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and a woman.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her meat selling business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 31, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells vegetables, earning $7 US per day. Her husband sells wooden furniture, earning $5 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 US on food and $25 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase more vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta Alicia M. de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, el lugar donde reside es muy concurrido y tiene muchos clientes que la visitan a diario. Berta es una mujer honesta y responsable además de ser muy servicial sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro y en su tienda encuentran lo que necesitan a un bien precio; esto la ha motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer con mas mercadería su tienda con productos como bebidas, sopas instantáneas, embutidos, golosinas entre otros. Y así no decepcionar a su clientela. Además esta es la forma en la que Berta lleva el sustento a su hogar y tiene esperanza que le permitirá darle a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Berta Alicia M. is 64 years old.  She lives with her life partner and two children in her own home, in San Salvador department.

Berta owns a store where she sells essentials.  Her store is located in her home.  It is very busy and she has a lot of customers who visit every day.  Berta is an honest and responsible woman who is also very helpful.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because she always greets them with a smile on her face and they find what they need in her store, at a good price.  For this reason, Berta is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to stock her store with more merchandise such as drinks, instant soups, cold meats, candies, etc. so that she does not disappoint her customers.  This is how Berta supports her household and she hopes that it will allow her to provide her family with a more decent life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, instant soups, cold meats and candies

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, tiene 37 años de edad, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 18,12 y 8 años  de edad respectivamente todos están estudiando, para ella representa su tesoro mas preciado ya que es por ellos que ella se levanta cada día para trabajar y ganarse honradamente el sustento familiar. Ella es dueña de un taxi el cual adquirió atraves de unos ahorros que ella fue adquiriendo por medio de unas remesas que le envían una familiar que vive en Estados Unidos con ese dinero que ella ha ahorrado fue que compro el taxi que es el negocio con el que ha mantenido económicamente a  su familia, también anteriormente ella vendía cosméticos. Hoy en día ella tiene a un trabajador que le hace el  turno desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, el es conductor de taxi.
Solicito el préstamo para realizarle arreglos al carro, comprarle un juego de llantas, realizarle un cheque  mecánico general al taxi. Ella espera que con os nuevos cambios que le realice al taxi podrá ofrecer un mejor servicios a sus pasajeros, estabilidad económica.
Desea en un futuro poder renovar su carro, comprar otro un poco mas moderno, ya que el que tiene esta un  poco  viejo. Su meta principal y la mas importante es sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que es por ellos que hace cualquier sacrificio quiere verlos con sus respectivas carreras profesionales.
texts.en:
María, age 37, is from the Estelí department.  She is a single mother, and she has three children; ages 18, 12, and 8.  All of them go to school.  To her they represent her most valuable treasure.  It is for them that she gets up every day to work and honorably earn the family's support.

She owns a taxi. She got it with the savings she was getting through remittances that a relative who lives in the United States was sending her.  With the money she had saved she bought the taxi.  It is the business that has supported her family.  Also, she previously sold cosmetics.

She now has a worker who takes a shift from six in the morning until nine at night.  He is a taxi driver.

She is requesting the loan to fix up the car.  She will buy a set of tires, and she will have a general mechanical check performed.  She hopes that with the new changes to the taxi she will be able to offer her passengers better service.  She also hopes for financial stability.

In the future she wishes to be able to renovate her car.  She wants to be able to buy another one that is a little more modern because the one she has is a little old.

Her primary and most important goal is to get her children ahead.  It is for them that she makes any and all sacrifices.  She wants to see her children have professional careers.

loans.use: to fix up the car, to buy a set of tires, and to have a general mechanical check performed.

loans.name: Byron Antonio

texts.es:
Byron, es un  joven de 28 años, originario de Condega ,municipio de Estelí, esta casado, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente,  de oficio agricultor , el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos . Sus inicios fueron duros desde su niñez, lo crio un señor quien le enseño el oficio de la agricultura y ganadería le trabajo durante 8 años ordeñándole a los animales, trabajando y preparando el terreno para siembra. Al tiempo se independizo, se caso con una muchacha proveniente de la comarca Santa Teresa, ubicada el municipio de Condega. Hoy en día vive en esta comarca es ahí donde siembra junto con su esposa, pues el padre de ella le dio esa tierra para que la trabajen.
Realizo el préstamo para sembrar una manzana de frijoles. Con esta inversión el espera sacar una producción de calidad con alto rendimientos que le permita vender esta cosecha a un buen precio. Desea componer su casa, brindarle un techo digno donde puedan vivir sus hijos. Una de  sus metas es poder comprar un terreno para ampliar su siembra y criar animales.
texts.en:
Byron is a 28-year old young man, originally from Condega in the Estelí municipality.  He is married, the father of two children ages 8 and 3, and a farmer.  He had a tough start as a youngster.  He was raised by a man who taught him about farming and raising livestock, and worked for 8 years tending to the animals and preparing the land for planting.  Over time, he became independent and married a woman from Santa Teresa in the Condega municipality.  These days, he lives in this region, which is where he plants along with his wife on land that her father gave them to work on.

He took out this loan to plant a plot of beans.  With the investment, he hopes for a crop that will yield in a quantity that will allow him to sell his harvest at a good price.  He hopes to outfit his house, thereby providing a dignified abode for his children to live in.  One of his goals is to buy some land in order to expand his crops and raise animals.

loans.use: plant a plot of beans.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE D. URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida, ella prepara distintos platos como anticuchos que es un plato a base D. carne con papas hechas en parrilla, también venD. caldo D. gallinas y asado D. carne, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria en el distrito D. Yucay,la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, papa, gallina, carne y leña.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the "San José D. Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Dominga is 53 years old, married, and has seven children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She prepares different dishes such as 'anticuchos' (a grilled meat and potato dish).  She also sells chicken soup and barbecued meats.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in Yucay district.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Dominga would like to expand and improve her food business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy products to cook such as rice, potatoes, chicken and meat.  She will also buy firewood.

Dominga is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food products to cook such as rice, potatoes, chicken, meat, and also firewood

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a single mother who lives with her son in the Valle region of Honduras. For the past 26 years she has made a living by making and selling freshly prepared tortillas at home. She has a very solid customer base, being that most of her clients are established restaurants or regular customers in her community. Beatriz has received a number of loans in the past and has a strong payment history. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 Honduran lempiras with which she will buy corn and firewood to prepare fresh tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is a humble villager who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is employed as a sewing worker in the local garment industry, earning a monthly salary.  She presently lives with her old father, who is a rice cultivator. Mrs. Thuy is a good mother to her two children, who are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Thuy would like to request a loan to buy planks to repair her broken walls and a new bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: to buy planks to repair her broken walls and a new bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 60 años de edad reside solo en su casa ya que todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya se encuentran casados. Rigoberto ha trabajado y sigue trabajando duramente para ganarse el pan de cada día. Es un hombre luchador el cual le gusta recibir el fruto de su esfuerzo. Él posee un pequeño puesto en el cual vende variedad de medicinas tales como: vitaminas, jarabes para la tos, alcohol, pastillas para dolores, y todo tipo de medicamento. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y concurrida en especial su negocio ya que toda la gente de su domicilio lo conoce por ser un hombre honesto y trabajador el cual ofrece calidad en los productos que ofrece. Es un hombre que le gusta tomar riesgos es por eso que ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para abastecer su negocio y comprar mercadería al por mayor como: variedad de pastillas, vitaminas, jarabes, pomadas, alcohol, y de mas productos que ayuden a atraer a más clientes y a mejorar las ventas para lograr obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida. Cabe mencionar que anteriormente ya ha  tenido crédito con INTEGRAL y se clasifica como un cliente responsable, el cual gracias a esta ayuda ha podido hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 60 years old and resides alone in his house, since all his children are grown and married. He has worked and continues to work hard to earn his daily bread. He is a competitive man who likes to receive the fruit of his efforts.

Rigoberto has a small post where he sells a variety of medicines such as: vitamins, cough syrups, alcohol, pain pills, and all kinds of medications. His business is located in a very strategic and much traveled zone. Everyone knows him as an honest and hard-working man who offers quality products.

Rigoberto is an enterprising person. That's why he came to INTEGRAL for a loan to stock his business and buy merchandise at wholesale, including a variety of pills, vitamins, syrups, pomades, alcohol, and other products that can attract more customers, increase sales, better his earnings and improve his condition of life.

It's worth mentioning that he has previously had loans through INTEGRAL and is classified as a responsible client who, thanks to this help, has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale, such as: a variety of pills, vitamins, syrups, pomades, alcohol, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Sharavdochin

texts.en:
Sharavdovchin, age 41, runs a public transportation business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After working for a public transportation company for twenty years, he decided to start a business by himself, using his own minivan. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes, which lacks bus services. 

Sharavdochin is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary tools and parts to renovate his minivan. A portion of the loan is also going toward the development of his business. He says that he is working hard to be able to afford to buy another minivan, which would help develop his business to a great extent.  

His children – aged 8, 15, and 17 – attend public school, while his wife works in the book section of a department store. Recently, Sharavdovchin’s family moved into a small house which he built using his past savings. He aims to increase his family income by expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary parts and tools to renovate his minivan.

loans.name: Ulziitogtoh

texts.en: Ulziitogtoh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His two children are one and three years old and stay at home with their mother. He manages a shoe repair business in his town. He started his business in 2000 with the help of his parents. However, he was able to open his own shoe repair business in 2005. With his earnings, he managed to build a house for his family. With six years of business operation, he has built a strong customer base and gained much experience. He is a diligent man who is planning to expand his business. He says, "I want to build a garage in near future also I want to have a car too." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair shoes

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 52 años, vive en la ciudad D. Concepción, ella está casada con el señor Julian, tienen 3 hijos todos ya son adultos, un varón y dos mujeres. La mayor ya se caso tiene su propia familia, el varón es policía y la otra hija está estudiando licenciatura en enfermería.
La señora tiene una pequeña granja donD. tiene sus vacas lecheras D. las cuales produce y venD. leche en su propia casa para el sustento y estudio D. sus hijos. Ella y su marido se iniciaron con una sola vaca hace más D. 20 años y poco a poco fueron creciendo hasta que hoy en día tienen más D. 17 vacas lecheras.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. balanceados y compra D. aparatos que van a ayudar para el tratamiento D. la leche. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 52 years old and lives in the city of Concepción. She is married to Sr. Julian and they have three children who are already adults, a son and two daughters. Her older daughter is married and has her own family. Her son is a police officer and her other daughter is studying for a nursing degree.

Sra. Maria has a small farm where she has dairy cows. She sells the milk they produce from her home in order to support her family and pay for her children’s education. Maria and her husband started out with only one dairy cow. More than 20 years later, they have steadily grown their business and now have more than 17 dairy cows.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy balanced feed and devices for treating milk. Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and devices for treating milk.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Rosalie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, 54, is the single mother of five children age 13 to 30 living in Hoima, Uganda.

Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been taking care of her children alone. 

For 30 years she has been operating a bar business. She faces a challenge in the high rate of bottle breakages and her dream is to move into a bigger business premise and own a hotel. 

Betty needs a loan to stock beer, spirits and soft drinks for sale.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks and spirits for sale.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La Sra. Roció cuenta con 52 años es casada tiene hijos los cuales ya se encuentra casados, su esposo se llama Eduardo él se dedica al servicio público, es taxista.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes no muy grande pero la cual ha sabido sacar adelante ahora dice que la surtirá mas y la ampliara mas con su préstamo ya que lo invertirá en la tienda para surtir y meter otros productos nuevos en su tienda como son: jugos, refrescos de  sabores variados, también meterá a vender el productos lácteos.

La Sra. Roció dice que esta agradecida ya que el préstamo le será de gran utilidad porque así pues su negocio estará surtido, ella quiera hacer una tienda más grande ya que eso serio mejor porque de ahí a solucionado sus problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Roció is 52 years old, married, and has children who are already married. Her husband Eduardo provides a public service as a taxi driver.

Roció is in the retail trade and manages a grocery store that is not very large, but it has allowed her to get ahead. Now she says that she wants to restock with more inventory and expand her business. With this loan, she will invest in her store by obtaining new products such as juices, soft drinks of different flavors, as well as dairy products.

Sra. Roció says that she is grateful. This loan will be of great use because her business will be well-stocked. She believes having a larger store will be better because it will help solve her financial problems.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, and dairy products.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Fe has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines and milkfish. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. Fe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
This is Darlyn, age 38, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She and her husband Bejamine, who works as a vendor, have five children. She and Benjamine share the responsibility in attending to their young children while at the same time earning an income to provide for their daily needs. 

Darlyn is a Balut vendor. In the Philippines, Balut is well-known egg snack that is sold on the sidewalk. It is a duck egg boiled with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is highly nutritious food that Filipinos love to eat, especially when they feel tired, as it revitalizes energy and strength. About 450 to 600 Balut eggs are boiled and sold every night. She and her husband not only prepare these eggs but also do the selling, which means they do not need to pay commissions to vendors to sell the eggs. They earn 300 Philippine Pesos (PhP) in sales per day.  

Darlyn is requesting a loan amounting to Php 10,000 that she will use as start-up capital for her additional business, which will involve selling fried chicken skin and quail eggs. There is a high demand for fried chicken skin and Darlyn wants to give it a try since her stall is located in a crowded and busy area. The remaining amount will be spent on purchasing additional Balut eggs.

Darlyn dreams of having a stall located in the market. She still has to wait a little longer to make this dream come true because she needs to prioritize being a mother to her young children. For now, Darlyn and her husband will continue to depend on to each other to make their small business grow for the sake of their children’s future. 

Darlyn never fails to attend weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to go on with her life no matter what the obstacles might be, because she has faith in a God Who she believes will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Balut and to add new food items to her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 63 years old and is married to Thomas. Together they have five adult children. She sells fish and also farms and has been in the business for the past year. She gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the business.

This is her third loan term from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of fish, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm. 

She will buy another piece of land with the anticipated profits. Her dream is to support her grandchildren financially.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Washington Javier

texts.es:
Washington de 37 años, trabaja como chofer de un servicio de transporte de tricimoto hace 1 año y 3 mese atrás y gracias A dios le ha ido muy bien.

El único problema es la delincuencia ya que recorre sectores peligros en su vehículo. No está casado solo trabaja para no tener ningún problema en el futuro.

El prestamo lo quiere para comprar herramientas para su tricimoto y darle mantenimiento. Su meta alcanzar es poder comprar su propia tricimoto para poder trabajar para el mismo y asi poder terminar de construir la casa en el terreno de su hermano.
texts.en:
Washington, 37, has worked as a mototaxi driver for the last year and three months; thanks be to God, he’s done very well.  The only problem is crime because he travels through dangerous sectors in his vehicle.  He is not married and works so that he will not have any problem in the future.

He needs the loan to buy tools for his mototaxi and to service it.  His goal is to be able to buy his own mototaxi so that he can work for himself and finish building the house on his brother’s lot.

loans.use: to repair his trimotor and buy tools.

loans.name: Nor Listn Den Say Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Maseray was born in Northern Sierra Leone. She is about 42 years of age. She is married to a driver and the couple has 8 children who are in secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Maseray has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells rice and palm-oil. This is the first loan that Maseray and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Maseray will use her share of the loan (600,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Bibosi Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento BIBOSI II se encuentra en su primer ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la localidad del Torno comunidad Limoncito cuenta con negocio y actividad propios. La Presidenta es la Sra. Dora D. 26 años D. edad  vive en el barrio Palestina D. la localidad D. el torno hace 2 años.
                                                                                                       Actividad es la venta D. ropa tiene un  puesto D. venta en el mercado  y también venD. en las zonas aledañas al municipio en las distintas ferias hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Convive  con el sr. Cesar el se dedica a trabajar como empleado en un fabrica tienen 2 hijos pequeños, quienes s son su razón para trabajar y seguir sacrificándose, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. ropa al por mayor ya que quiere abastecerse D. mercadería por estas fiestas D. fin D. año ya que tiene gran demanda, la Sra. Dora es una persona joven trabajadora con esta actividad aporta a los gastos D. casa y se siente feliz por la oportunidad que se le brindo.       
                                                                                                            Todos las socias están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder crecer en su negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
The BIBOSI II Community Bank is maD. up of 8 members who live in Torno in the community of Limoncito. All the members have their own businesses. Mrs. Dora is the President is 26 years old and has lived in el Torno for two years.

She has a clothing stall in the local market, and she also sells her goods in neighboring villages and different fairs in the area. She has had this business for four years. She lives with her partner Cesar, who works in a factory. They have two small children, who are her reason for working and sacrificing. The loan money will be used to purchase wholesale clothing to sell during the end of the year festivals when there is high demand. Mrs. Dora is a hardworking young person who uses her earnings to support her family and is happy for this opportunity. 

All of the members are thankful for this organization who have placed trust in them and have given them support to grow their businesses.

loans.use: wholesale purchase of clothing

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is a loving father and husband. He has been involved in farming for 10 years. He is 30 years old and raising four children and tries to work hard to provide the best conditions for his family. He is now requesting a loan for P25,000 to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in preparing his farm. He hopes to obtain plentiful crops in the harvest season in order to save for the education of his children, as well as to secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in preparing his farm

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 50 years old, widowed and has three children, only one still in school. Being a widowed mother, she has been selling Chinese noodle and rice soup to make a living. She has been with this business for more than ten years. She started taking a loan from Vision Fund four years ago. The loans from Vision Fund have helped her have regular income and send her child to school. Now she earns more than twenty U.S. dollars per day from her current business and saves less than five U.S. dollars per day.

Hoeurn and her group member Ngeb who has been with Vision Fund for three years are applying for another loan. She will use this loan to buy ingredients and foodstuffs for her business. She hopes to grow her business and make a good profit and also keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Ellie

texts.en:
Ellie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Ellie has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ellie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ellie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Moussodjeton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Moussodjeton 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djalakoro, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  TENENA, présidente du groupe  assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter essentiellement des intrants pour l’exploitation de 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Moussodjeton 1 Group are married women with an average age of 41 and an average of five children. They all live in traditional families in Djalakoro, one of the villages of San, the fourth administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural businesses through the winter season. They are currently on their fourth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have all been repaid. 

Tenena, the president of the group seated in the middle of the photo, cultivates groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to primarily purchase inputs for use in 1.5 hectares of land. After harvest, her produce will be sold in the village and at San market to a customer base of resellers. She expects to make an average profit of 225,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia Judith es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos. 

La socia Judith sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Santo Domingo" y sigue con el negocio de venta de jugos, ella sigue vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del cusco, ella trabaja en el negocio de venta de jugos desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al desempeño de su trabajo. La socia tambien alquila carros que sirven para brindar servicio de trasportes.  

La socia Judith solicita el préstamo para comprar más frutas como por ejemplo manzanas, naranjas, piñas, papayas, plátanos y otras más. La socia Judith está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Judith is a native of the city of Cusco. She lives in the same city where she was born. She is 34 years old and has two children.

She continues to be a member of the "Santo Domingo" communal bank and continues with her business of selling juice. She still sells in one of the markets of the city of Cusco. She works in her juice business from 7 am until 9 pm. She has already worked in this business for 10 years and it is going very well for her, thanks to her performance of her work.

Judith is applying for the loan to buy more fruits, for example, apples, oranges, pineapples, papayas, bananas, and others. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to maintain her car and buy spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food stall. 

Marilou is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stock of water melon fruits for sale.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is a married woman, with five school children, living in the Faleapuna village. She operates a flea market business, selling peas, coconuts used to make creams, Samoan cocoa to make tea, and other items like brooms, fine mats and bananas. She joined the SPBD program in June 2005 when she needed help for her business. Her husband is unemployed but helps Pepe run the business. To upgrade their way of living, pay the kids' school fees, and pay food expenses were the reasons Pepe decided to open a small business because before this they relied heavily on overseas remittance.

loans.use: To buy fine mats and boards for printing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iceboxes

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus Amado Ramirez is a carpenter and makes furniture such as chests of drawers, chairs, and tables. He began his career as a carpenter working for someone else, but then decided to start his own business in order to make more money. Jesus started his microenterprise 10 years ago.

Jesus is 36 years old, married, and has 2 sons and 2 daughters ages 16, 11, 7, and 3. Jesus works from the back of his house. He has a large patio area that he has converted for his business, while in the front of the house, his wife runs a copetin, a small food store, that sells sandwiches and empanadas.

Jesus works from Monday to Saturday from 7 am to 5 pm and takes a 2 hour lunch break and siesta. He only makes furniture when he receives an order from his clients.

Jesus needs this loan in order to buy more wood and supplies to complete an order he recently received.

loans.use: Purchase wood and supplies

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana M. is a new member of the programme who just joined in the last month. This lady already has the skills needed for her agriculture business.  She has an existing vegetable garden which earns her a living of about $100 per week.    She has been unemployed for several months but now she realised that by expanding her vegetable garden she can earn more than the salary she used to get when she was employed.  With a little loan of $300 she expects  to earn an additional $100 per week.

loans.use: Buy cabbage seeds, knives, spades and other tools for her business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: I am Shaheen A., and I was born and brought up in Abbotabad, a small mountainous town. After my marriage I had to move to Lahore with my husband. I have eight children, two daughters and six sons. All of my sons together operate an embroidered clothes business except the youngest one who studies in grade ten. They started this business with the loan I took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. My sons need to expand their business so that they can take on bigger orders and earn more. They will buy an embroidery frame and a peco machine. We need a loan.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothes business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is married with no children. His wife is a seamstress who is working very hard to support family finances.  Daniel is a Trader. He deals in building materials, supplying paint and other building materials.  Daniel wants to sell PVC pipes because he receives a lot of orders from his customers but needs needs additional capital.  He is asking for a loan of US $1,200 to buy more nails, PVC pipes, iron sheets, wheel barrows, mosquito net, and paint which are highly demanded by his customers.

loans.use: To buy more nails, PVC pipes, iron sheets, wheel barrows, mosquito net, and paint which are highly demanded by his customers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Anna K. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is single with four children, aged 12,18, 21, and 24. In 1998 Anna established a catering and clothing business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional ingredients, equipment, and stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and clothing stock in bulk.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida Rosa is a very stressed woman originally of the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. For awhile she has forced herself to better the condition of her business because she is the mother of 2 children who have the necessity to study because they are young. She began her business in her house 12 years ago and now she has a big problem to fix because she does not have the money to buy the products she sells. Because of this she went to Ceprodel for assistance and for the last 2 years she has benefited from them with credits that have enabled her to supply her business and in this way give her children the education they need.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Candida Rosa es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Por mucho tiempo ha venido esforzándose por mejorar la condición de su negocio debido a que es madre de 2 hijos con la necesidad de estudiar por ser menores de edad.

Su negocio lo inicia en su casa de habitación desde hace 12 años y hoy en día atraviesa una gran necesidad como lo es que no posee el dinero suficiente para la adquisición de sus productos. Es por este motivo que asiste a Ceprodel quien desde hace 2 años la ha beneficiado con créditos que según cuenta le han be4neficiado para surtir su negocio y de esta manera brindarle la educación a sus pequeños que tanto lo necesitan.

loans.use: To purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Thi Chi's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chi has two children who are still going to school right now. In her free time, she usually participate in social activities of her town and district. Outside of communities work, she also breed poultry to increase family income in order to fund for her children to go to school. Her family earning is roughly 150,000 Dong per day. Mrs. Luyen, Mrs. Tuyen and Mrs. Lan all want to take out a loan to breed pig. Mrs. Bon need this loan cycle to buy foodstuff for her hen. Everyone in the group joined Binh Minh CDC (Kiva partner) because of they are allowed to pay in small payment for a longer time.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Chi có 2 con đang còn đi học. Chị thường xuyên tham gia công tác xã hội của thôn, tổ. N.ài công việc đoàn thể, chị còn chăn nuôi tăng gia săn xuất để có thêm thu nhập nuôi các con ăn học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 150000đồng/ngày. Chị Luyện và Chị Tuyến vay để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Lân vay để mua lợn giống. Chị Bốn vay để mua thức ăn cho gà đẻ trứng. Cả 5 chị đều rất thích tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được vay lâu dài và chỉ cần trả góp hàng tuần với số tiền nhỏ.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi

loans.name: I Kadek Putra

texts.id:
I Kadek Putra is a farmer and he works on a land of 1 hectare (around 10,000 square meter). He needs a continuous supply of water to irrigate his paddy field. In his village, farmers get together and make a group to arrange, create and manage a mutual irrigation system. In this group, each member get an equal share of water for irrigation.

Farmer who wants to join into this group has to pay some amount of dues. Therefore I Kadek Putra needs some money to enable him to join this group to secure irrigation for his paddy field. Furthermore he also needs money to buy paddy seeds and pesticide. With the loan money he hopes he can afford to have good quality paddy seeds, fertilizer and good irrigation, so he will be able to improve the quality of his harvest. This will of course translate to improvement of his family's well being.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam proses pengolahan persawahan, pengairan yang baik sangat dibutuhkan karena tanaman padi sangat memerlukan air pada masa pertumbuhannya. Hal yang sama juga dialami oleh I Kadek Putra. Untuk mengerjakan sawahnya yang seluas 1 hektar, ia memerlukan pengairan yang terjaga selama masa pertumbuhan tanaman padinya. Di desa tempat I Kadek Putra tinggal, para petani padi tergabung dalam satu kelompok yang khusus menangani pengairan ke sawah – sawah sehingga para petani mendapat jatah air yang sama. Setiap petani yang ingin mendapatkan air harus masuk kedalam kelompok tersebut dan diwajibkan membayar iuran yang sudah disepakati. Selain untuk membeli pupuk, anti hama dan bibit padi, I Kadek Putra harus mengeluarkan dana untuk iuran air di kelompoknya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, ia merencanakan untuk meningkatkan kwalitas persawahannya dengan membeli bibit padi jenis unggul dan pupuk dalam jumlah yang cukup sehingga ia tidak akan kehabisan ditengah jalan. I Kadek Putra optimis, dengan kwalitas padi yang lebih baik, ia akan dapat meningkatkan hasil penjualannya untuk menambah pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy water/ irrigation and fertilizer (Membeli air dan pupuk)

loans.name: Jorgeñitas Group

texts.es:
The women of the Jorgeñitas group come from the beautiful town of San Jorge la Laguna, a town located at the edges of the beautiful lake of Atitlán. These women reflect at first sight a confidence that calls your attention, so that while conducting the interview I was discovering the reason for this confidence.

The great majority are artisans and they work making necklaces of jewels. They produce beautiful earrings, bracelets, and necklaces with pearlites imported from the Czech Republic. Some say that this art of making necklaces was imported to lake Atitlán by European artisans several decades ago. There are also women who invest their capital in small convenience stores and knitting machines. They buy thread to create beautiful Guatemalan embroidered dresses and traditional blouses.

When the artisans begin to share how they are going to invest their loans one can realize the dimension of their businesses. The jewelers revealed that with the loan that they are going to receive they were going to buy the materials for the necklaces by the kilogram, while the great majority of artisans buy the materials for necklaces by the ounce. This reflects that they are in a little more advanced phase of business development, since the quantity of commodity that they are going to buy is a lot greater than that of the majority of artisans around la Laguna.

The Jorgeñitas have been working with Friendship Bridge for more than a year and they have benefited from the training given by the loan agents. The women commented that they were interested a lot in the themes of saving money, natural medicine and especially family planning. They mentioned what a large impact it had on them to know that a woman is able and has the authority to plan the size of her family.

Also they mentioned that they like to work with microfinance institutions, especially with Friendship Bridge, because they ask few requirements, the disbursements are fast and they help them with their business. If you contribute to the success of these artisans then they are going to be able to continue developing their qualities as businesswomen and artisans.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres del grupo Jorgeñitas provienen del bello pueblo de San Jorge la Laguna. Un pueblo ubicado a las orillas del hermoso lago de Atitlán. Estas mujeres reflejan a primera vista una confianza que llama la atención, conforme fue transcurriendo la entrevista fui descubriendo el porque de esta confianza.

La gran mayoría son artesanas y trabajan elaborando joyas de mostacilla. Ellas producen hermosos aretes, brazaletes, collares con perlitas de mostacillas importadas de la República Checa. Algunos dicen que este arte de la mostacilla fue importado al lago Atitlán por artesanos Europeos hace ya varias décadas. También se encuentran mujeres que invierten su capital en pequeñas tiendas de conveniencia y tejedoras que compran hilo para elaborar bellos huipiles Guatemaltecos, blusas tradicionales.

Cuando las artesanas empezaron a compartir en que van a invertir su crédito uno se puede dar cuenta de la dimensión de su empresa. Las joyeras revelaron que con el préstamo que van a recibir iban a comprar las bolsas de mostacilla por kilo, mientras la gran mayoría de artesanas compran la mostacilla por onzas. Esto refleja que ellas están en una etapa de desarrollo empresarial un poco más avanzada, ya que la cantidad de materia prima que van a comprar es mucho mayor al de la mayoría de artesanas alrededor de la laguna.

Las Jorgeñitas han venido trabajando con Friendship Bridge por más de un año y se han beneficiado con las capacitaciones impartidas por las agentes de crédito. Las mujeres comentaban que a ellas les interesaron mucho los temas de ahorro del dinero, medicina natural y especialmente planificación familiar. Ellas mencionaron que les causó un impacto grande el hecho de conocer que una mujer puede y tiene la autorización de planificar el tamaño de su familia.

También mencionaron que les gusta trabajar con las instituciones de microfinanzas, especialmente con Friendship Bridge porque piden pocos requisitos, los desembolsos son rápidos y las ayudan con sus negocios. Si ustedes contribuyen con el éxito de estas artesanas entonces ellas van a poder seguir desarrollando sus cualidades como empresarias y artesanas.

loans.use: To buy jewels for creating necklaces, products for a convenience store and thread for weaving and embroidery.

loans.name: En Prak Group

texts.en: Five people in Samrith Chey Village have formed a business group with Mrs. En P. as the group leader. She is a mat maker. Her business now has a problem, because she does not have enough money to buy more raw materials to make mats to sell. Thus,  Mrs. En P. decided to access a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Chanthou L., is a subsistence farmer.  Mrs. En P.  and her husband have five children, three of whom are studying at state school while the remaining two are too young to work or study. Last year,  Mrs. En P.  obtained a loan to buy raw material in order to start her mat business.

loans.use: buy more raw materials to make mats to sell.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim S., 54, has worked with her husband growing rice on her rice field since 1979. Besides working on the rice paddy, her husband also works as a traditional musician.

In Cambodia, there are a number of ceremonies, parties, wedding parties and other festivals and celebrations during a year. A traditional musician is hired to perform at each ceremony to make the occasion more traditional and enjoyable. Sim S.'s husband is sometimes asked to perform traditional music when there is a ceremony or celebration in his town. With the additional US$ 5 per day he makes from his work, he normally invests in his farming and pays his family’s expenses.

Now Mrs. Sim S. and her husband would like to purchase a cow to assist in plowing their paddy and also farming necessities such as fertilizer and insecticide. She believes the help from this loan will positively impact her family and enable her to expand and harvest more crops.

Sim S. has seven children. Three of them are single and the rest are married. (She is pictured with her husband and two grandchildren.)

loans.use: to purchase a cow, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Diariatou

texts.fr:
38-year-old Diariatou Sané, married with seven children in her care, has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian bank for five years. She trades in dried fish, peanuts and vegetables. She wishes to improve her standard of living, and the health and education of her children The loan that she has requested would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Diariatou Sané 38ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 5 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des poissons séchés, de la pâte d'arachides et des légumes(oignions, aubergine ,etc..). Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Vente de poissons séchés, pâte d'arachide et légumes

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza R. is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She began her business to support her family and aging parents. She learned to process dried fruits and clingstone apricots ten years ago. Since she started her business, her professional growth and development have consistently been supported through IMON’s micro-finance program. Mahfuza has repaid each loan faithfully and fully.

Mahfuza has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Thus her children and parents help Mahfuza with her business. Now her business is running successfully and it brings considerable income for her family. Today she is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni (1000 USD) for the term of 7 months to purchase more dried fruits due to great demand from her customers. Mahfuza and her friendly family sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits for processing and re-sale

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness O. sells clothes in her shop. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. Happiness travels to Ogun state (a journey of 2 hours by car) twice a month to purchase clothes to sell in Lagos state. She is 38 years old and married with two children. Happiness is a LAPO client, and needs a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She remains grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est âgé de 36 ans et gagne sa vie en conduisant un véhicule taxi à Kpalimé une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. ces derniers temps il a problème de moteur et passe tout son temps au garage. Il désire par ce crédit acquérir un nouveau moteur afin de relancer son activité.
texts.en:
Kokou A. is 36 years old and earns his living driving a taxi in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. For the last few times, he has had engine problems and spends all his time at the garage. He would like to use this loan to acquire a new motor in order to restart his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Erika De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Esta Joven emprendedora de nombre Erika  de La Concepción C.  de 33 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos el varón tiene la edad de 14 años de edad y cursa  recientemente el 3 año de secundaria y su hija de 13 años cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como taxista, los propósitos que esta joven tiene es de extender su negocio por lo que necesita preparar a su hijos para el mañana y también en sus deseos esta comprarle una casa propia para sus hijos razón por la que necesita luchar muy duro par sacar adelante a su familia y realizar sus propósitos.


El tiempo que tiene en su negocio es de 4 años, la actividad económica  la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general en lo que vende lo siguiente: pantalones, short, camisas, cremas y body,  la venta de plata Ella inicia este negocio por desde muy pequeña le gustaba ser independiente por lo que empieza con la venta de granos básicos en su casa de habitación y fue de así que decidió quedarse con el negocio de la venta en mercadería en general, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de sus productos como es la plata ya que necesita distribuir sus productos en los diferentes departamentos ya que ella lo realiza por medio de encargos.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur named Erika de La Concepción C. is a 33-year-old married mother of 2 children. Her son is 14 and is in his third year of middle school, while her daughter is 13 and is in her first year of middle school. Her husband works as a taxi cab driver. This young woman has the goal of expanding her business so that she can prepare her children for the future. She also wishes to buy her own house for her children, which is why she needs to work hard in order to help her family get ahead and reach their goals.

She has had her business for 4 years, selling general merchandise like pants, shorts, shirts, lotion, body sprays, and silver. She started this business because from a young age, she has always liked to be independent, which is why she started selling staple grains from home. She then decided to stay in business by selling general merchandise. She needs this loan as work capital to purchase products like silver in order to distribute her merchandise to the different departments because she sells by catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Bulaga B-Pauline Group

texts.en:
Pauline N., age 30, operates a fast-moving consumer goods grocery shop on Bulaga Mityana Road. She also offers tailoring services under the same roof. It is the income from tailoring that enabled her to start her grocery business. She is very skilled at making traditional outfits for both gents and ladies from bitenge, bikoi, and bark cloth.

Due to insufficient funds, Pauline lacks most of the essential commodities in her grocery shop. However, the loan is now helping her stock both soft drinks and alcohol. She is so excited to be able to replace the home-boiled drinking water that she used to sell to her customers cheaply with bottled mineral water that she buys in cartons from various beverage companies. 

Married with four children between ages of 8 and 10, she works tirelessly to ensure that her children's needs are met. She hopes that, with a good turn of events, she will one day open a large wholesale shop offering a variety of fast-moving consumer goods to retailers. With enough savings, she will, no doubt, build a modern residence and ensure that her children get the best education.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and alcohol.

loans.name: Bariaa

texts.en:
Bariaa is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Bariaa has owned a chocolate decorations and a sewing shop for seven years. In her shop, she sells chocolate and cakes and she also sews. Bariaa has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop like decoration items for the chocolate, ingredients for cakes, coffee, and thread for sewing. This is the first time that Bariaa has requested a loan.

Bariaa is special in her work because she is the only one in her area and she has competitive prices for her sewing business. Her clients are her friends, family members, neighbors and surrounding villages. Bariaa decided on doing this business because she learned how to do chocolate decoration and sewing. In the future, she plans to expand her business by working for wedding ceremonies and she also plans on purchasing a Nescafe machine and an ice cream machine.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her businesses

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Ms. Nina B. is the provider and breadwinner in her family; she has had to face many problems in her life, in order to help her children to have all their needs fulfilled. Nina's main activity is growing cereals and grain legumes, including the production of seeds. Nina is requesting a loan from MicroInvest to purchase all kinds of seeds she needs to increase her harvest. Through this she believes that she could increase her business to support her family.

Nina has been running her business since 1997 with very little capital. The business is located in Falesti district, Pruteni village. The land is plowed with the help of her horse Castan who helps his master by saving her money that she would otherwise have to spend to buy fuel. One future plan of Ms. B. is to increase her working capital for growing cereals.

loans.use: purchase seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Santos C. vive en la aldea de San Jeronimo, ella es muy humilde y comenzo con su negocio hace 28 años ya que ella tuvo que sacrificarse para salir adelante y asi poder darle a sus hijos estudio, alimentacion y hogar. en total ella tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 son profesionales y le ayudan economicamente, otros 3 estudian en el colegio y los otros 2 se desplazan a distintas aldeas y caserios para vender sus rosquillas (este es su negocio pricipal) ella tambien tiene una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende cosas basicas para los vecinos de la comunidad.
para fabricar las rosquillas ella compra maiz, cuajada, mantequilla, leña.
su esposo le ayuda ya que el se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de ganado, ellos dos son muy unidos y juntos desean salir adelante para que sus dias sean mejores.
ella con este prestamo quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y tambien mejorar su negocio, asi podra apoyar mas a sus hijos que estudian.
su mayor sueño es que todos sus hijos fueran profesionales para poder desarrollarse en la vida, tambien su otro sueño es que su negocio sea de los mas grandes en la zona para poder tener muchos clientes y muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos C. lives in the village of San Jeronimo. She is humble and started her business 48 years ago because she had to make sacrifices to go forward so that she could provide an education, food, and a home for her children. She has 8 children, of whom 3 are professionals and help her financially. Three of her children are in secondary school, and the other 2 moved to other villages and hamlets to sell their ring-shaped pastries, which is their main business. She also has a small store where she sells basic goods for her neighbors in the community. To produce the pastries, she buys corn, curd, butter, and firewood. Her husband helps her by working in agriculture and raises livestock. The two of them are very close, and together, they want to go forward so that their days will be better. With this loan, she wants to improve her quality of life and also to improve her business. In this way, she will be able to support her school-age children. Her biggest dream is that her children will become professionals so that they can improve their lives. Her other dream is for her business to be one of the biggest in the area so that she can have many clients and a lot of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make ring-shaped pastris and to buy drinks, churros, cookies, candies, lollipops, lard, batteries, toilet paper, and ham.

loans.name: Daglive Molibo

texts.fr: Madame Daglive malibe est une femme mariée avec trois enfants (03), elle vit dans le quartier de hedzranawoé à lomé avec sa famille, cette dame est une revendeuse de céréales, elle a commencé à exercer cette activité depuis 1990, sa clientèle ne cesse de s’accroître. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locales d’assahon, notse et atakpamé. Elle veut rehausser son stock de marchandises, pour le faire elle demande à WAGES un prêt pour acheter  03 sacs de maïs, 04 sacs d’haricots et 02 sacs de mils. Son commerce lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Daglive Malibo is a married woman with three children. She lives in the neighbourhood fo Hezranawoé in Lomé with her family. She sells cereals and has been doing so since 1990: her customer base continues to grow. She gets her product from the local markets of Assahon, Notse and Atakpamé. She wants to increase her stock of merchandise and has asked WAGES for a loan for this purpose: she will buy three bags of corn, four bags of beans and two bags of millet. Her business allows her to help her husband with the day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
