loans.use: To buy corn, beans and millet

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21 year old man who lives with his parents in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ali has owned a barber shop since 1998. Ali has requested a loan of 1,200 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and beauty products for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because of his experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing tools for his salon. Ali chose his business because he learned it through an academy. In the future, he plans on purchasing a bigger salon.

loans.use: To purchase tools and beauty products for his work

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
J. Luz has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to acquire a new fishing boat for her fishing business. She is 52-years old, married and blessed with three children. Among the three children, two are still studying. Her husband is a carpenter.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost nine years under the microfinance program. She is reliable and active in all Coop activities. In fact, she is the chief of her center. She wants to improved her business and increase her income so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: To acquire a new fishing boat

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Ernestina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Ernestina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas en gran parte son al crédito.
Ernestina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos.
Ernestina sueña con tener un negocio estable y grande.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the community bank Paraíso (Paradise). Ernestina lives with her partner, is 24 years old, and has 1 son. Ernestina travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she takes orders for clothing. Her products are gotten in the city of Lima, and her sales are for the most part on credit. Ernestina needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of pants and polo shirts. Ernestina's dream is to have a stable and large business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and polo shirts

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.en:
Aziza has been a chicken and chapati seller in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro for two years. She belongs to the Uamsho loan group (group code 2049/05). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her business by buying more chicken for resale. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and her business will grow.

Aziza is 44 years old and married with three children, ages 25, 15, and 12. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Hadija, Husna, Rehema, and Maria. Each woman also has her own small business in Morogoro.

loans.use: To buy more buy more chicken for resale.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: M. Joyce, 50, is the chairperson of her lending group in Kisoga. She is married, has 3 grown up children and cares for 8 grandchildren at home. She has a farming business, supplying fresh beans, potatoes, and cassava to schools. Payments for her produce are usually made each week. She also sells ladies clothing, mostly underwear, to offices, hospitals, schools, and private homes, thrice in a week. Joyce needs her portion of this group loan to buy more clothes for sale and to employ manpower to help collect the produce from the villages. She is a hardworking and devoted mother with a drive to continued success.

loans.use: Buying more produce and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business by buying more materials

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 42 years old.  She is married and the mother of five kids. Currently, all her children are in school. She has been sewing for the past 21 years. She is a specialist in female and kids wear. Her skills and designs are of class.  She sews various kinds of attire that give her customers a new look, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She also sews night gowns and supplies them to hospitals and senior high school children. 

She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She would be grateful for your assistance for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is married with two children. She shares a business with her husband and sells various decoration items for houses. Olga has been in this business for 12 years. Olga enjoys helping people to choose various decoration items and make their homes look more nice and attractive. Olga would like to borrow 18,100 UAH to increase his inventories. Olga would use additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Amanecer Vino Tinto Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Amanecer D. Vino Tinto” estan representados por la señora Eugenia y conformada por 12 socios D. los cuales tres son varones y el resto mujeres. La presidenta al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la atención D. una tienda D. abarrotes, los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta D. víveres, venta D. cosméticos, venta y elaboración D. masitas y repostería, atención tienda D. barrio, venta D. libros, D. comidas, confección D. mochilas y prendas D. vestir, elaboración D. muebles D. madera. El grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo juntos y expresan su voluntad D. trabajar con el crédito otorgado por la institución la misma que les será D. gran ayuda para el fortalecimiento y expansión D. sus diferentes negocios y actividades, algunos D. ellos ya ha trabajado con grupos solidarios por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y desean seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus familias un mejor futuro. El refinanciamiento esta dirigido a la compra D. herramientas, materia prima, expansión D. sus talleres y otros que se traducirán en la capitalización D. sus actividades para poder obtener mejores ingresos que ayudaran a mantener a su familia con una calidad D. vida mas razonable.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the “Amanecer D. Vino Tinto”, three men and the remainder women, group are represented by Eugenia. The group's president and some of her co-members run grocery stores, while other members are engaged in such businesses as the sale of foodstuffs, cosmetics, selling and making cakes and pastries, running a local store, selling books, meals, making rucksacks and clothing and producing wooden furniture. The group is now in its second cycle, and will find the credit provided by the institution of great help in their enthusiastic efforts to strengthen and expand their various businesses. Some have previously worked with other community-based groups, giving them experience of such organizations and the desire to continue their efforts to proviD. their families with a better future. The new loan will be used to purchase tools and raw materials, to expand workshops and other forms of capital investment in their businesses, with the aim of increasing their revenue to maintain a more decent standard of living for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto R. tiene ya más de veinte cinco años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para el ya que es viudo y sus hijos ya están grandes y tiene su propia familia. 
Solicita un préstamo por que al negocio le está haciendo falta mas materia prima para poder realizar los muebles que le están solicitando, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar del material y así poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo para que sus clientes lo puedan recomendar con otras personas.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de los muebles.
texts.en:
Gilberto Rodríguez has been making furniture from wood for over 25 years. This business is the source of income he has for himself. He is a widower, and his children are grown and have their own families. He is asking for a loan because he needs raw materials for his business to make the furniture people are ordering. At this time he does not have enough money to buy the material in order to be able to deliver the orders to his customers on time. Delivering on time allows the customers to recommend him to other people. He plans to repay the loan with the earnings he gets by selling the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material for his carpintry business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia A. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, onions, etc., and is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Cicilia is 35 years old and is married to an accountant. She has one child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Obinna

texts.en:
Obinna is 35 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a contractor. 

Obinna sells groceries and food items. She is so happy because of her Kiva loan. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and food items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food items

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora G. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Teodora owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teodora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Afrita Julio

texts.pt:
Afrita Júlio I. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 51 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 28, 26, 20, e 13 anos de idade, três destes vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e ainda sustenta a mãe e o pai que vivem com ela. 

Saiu da Matola para Distrito de Boane no bairro Xinonankila há mais de 10 anos com os seus filhos, depois de ter construído a sua residência. Trabalha numa serigrafia como encadernadora há mais de 4 anos, faz 8 horas de trabalho por dia e tem um salário mensal de 5.300.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, pedra, areia e janelas) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa, comprar mobiliário para melhor acomodar a sua família.
texts.en:
Afrita Júlio I. was born in Matola, Maputo Province, Mozambique. She is 51 years old and a single mother of four children ages 28, 26, 20 and 13, three of them students. She finished 6th grade but had to drop school due to lack of financial support. She lives in her own house with her children and supports her parents who also live with them. She left Matola to go to Boane more than 10 years ago with her children, after having built her home. She works at a serigraphy and makes 5.300,00MT (U$170) per month, money that she uses to cover her household expenses and save. This is her second loan and she's asking for 16.000,00MT (U$525) in order to buy construction supplies (zinc plates, rocks, sand and windows) to finish building her house. Her previous loan was used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to get other loans to finish building her house, buy furniture and better accomodate her large family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Badema Group

texts.en: Bendu K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Badema. She is married with 3 children aged 20-23 years old, and their educational levels are 6th grade to high school graduate. Bendu is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in central Voinjama, and works in the central market of Voinjama City, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia. Her business is clothing. She buys used clothes wholesale and sells retail to other vendors in the Voinjama central market, Liberia. Bendu has been running this business for 20 years, and hopes to improve by having a store. She treats her customers well in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. Bendu needs this loan to purchase more clothes to improve her business. She dreams of giving her family and kids the best support.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en: Altanbagana is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of his sons, aged 14 and 17, are in a local secondary school. Altanbagana operates a business making wooden products in his town. He designs and produces a variety of wooden furniture, focusing mainly on making doors. Altanbagana started his business in 2000. Using his experience, he has built a stable business over the years, and his many customers are very satisfied with the quality items he produces. As a young, business-minded entrepreneur, Altanbagana has developed good taste in making unique and stylish furniture that is in demand. He is focused on the future and has plans to open his own work place soon. He says, "I want to improve my business so I can build my own factory in the future." He is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen P., 48, is married and lives with her five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  P. has a business weaving Cambodia traditional silk, earning an income of US $3 per day. She has been doing this business since 2004. Her husband raises ducks to produce eggs for sale, earning US $3 per day. P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to take care of the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more ducks to raise for their eggs. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Evelyn Alicia

texts.es:
U. R. EVELYN ALICIA


Evelyn es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto  a su esposo y a su hijo de 9 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender jugos naturales de fruta en la plaza de armas de la ciudad en donde vive. Ella nos comenta que el negocio empezó hace 8 años y estaba a cargo de su madre, luego de un tiempo su madre la dejó a cargo de el y con mucho esfuerzo lo hizo crecer. Evelyn nos dice que poco a poco pudo comprar una carpa y una vitrina para poder mostrar pasteles preparados por ella misma, los cuales también gozan de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes.

Evelyn utiliza las ganancias obtenidas del negocio en la ayuda de la economía de su familia, su esposo trabaja en la empresa agrícola de la zona, y también apoya al sostenimiento de su madre. La creciente demanda por su negocio, propia de la época de verano, ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio, por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de frutas, vasos de vidrio y una nueva vitrina.

Ella es una mujer alegre, dinámica y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es poder tener su casa propia ya que viven en una alquilada.
texts.en:
U. R. EVELYN ALICIA Evelyn, 27, lives with her husband and 9-year-old son in Cayaltí district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She sells fruit juices in her city of residence's main square. She tells us that the business was begun 8 years ago by her mother who eventually left her in charge of it; through much effort she has made it grow. Evelyn tells us that she was able to eventually buy a tent and a display case to display cakes that she makes herself; they are also well-received by her customers. Evelyn uses her profits to support her family economically. Her husband works for the agricultural company in the area and also helps support his mother. The growing demand for her products, typical of the Summer season, has led her to think about enlarging her business. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy fruit, drinking glasses and a new display case. She is a cheerful, dynamic and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to have her own home because they currently live in a rented one.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit, drinking glases and a display case.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: B. Pascaline est née en 1970 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique. Depuis 21 ans, Pascaline vit dans le quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à ZANNOU Jean, un boucher, Pascaline est mère de trois enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés.  Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pascaline n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Pascaline vend de la bouillie «Akpan » (nourriture fait à base d’amidon de maïs). Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pascaline a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pascaline sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Pascaline B. was born in 1970 in Allada in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. For the past 21 years she has lived in the Dadji district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Jean ZANNOU, a butcher, Pascaline has three children. Not all the children are at school. Pascaline lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Pascaline has never been to school. In order to meet her needs, she sells "Akpan" cereal (made of corn starch). She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Pascaline has already had one loan from ALIDé which she repaid without incident. She is applying for a second loan in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, sugar and milk

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak C. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in the Prey Ampok village of Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. To increase their income and improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Nak C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her fam crop. 

Aside from farming, her husband is fisherman who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nak C. is a mother of five children, one of whom is farmer, the other three are students in the local school, while the youngest is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: A cow, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn R. is from the village of San Marcos. She is 23 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marilyn R.'s Group.

Marilyn is single. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana Rosa tiene 33 años, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Ella se dedica a una pulpería  por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar ya que tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, golosinas y detergente. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 33 years old. She is a very industrious woman who enjoys working in a local grocery shop and has always liked her work. She has three dependent children and strives to provide the income necessary for her family. Currently, Juana Rosa is requesting a loan for the purchase of staple grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, and detergent. Her dream is to have a house with amenities as well as to have a very profitable business established in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
For the second time since becoming a member of ASHI in 2009, 27-year-old Joan R. is requesting a loan. She was able to repay the full amount of her last loan on time. Though her variety store has not been sustained, its small profit somehow provided her family with the necessities. Joan is just sad because she has allowed a lot of people to purchase items she sells on credit, expecting that she could be paid back. Instead of regret, Joan feels happy to have had that experience, because from it she learned about managing and dealing with costumers. She also learned that her 24-year-old husband who is a driver will still support her, even in her disappointments. Now, Joan and her husband have decided to use this loan she is requesting to start up a hog fattening business.

Hog fattening is a kind of business wherein, after four months of raising or fattening hogs, the hog will be sold to people in their village or in the market, either alive or slaughtered. The larger the volume of hogs being sold, the larger the profit. Therefore, Joan can put up a savings fund for her four children whose age range is from one to seven years old. Through this she hopes to support their education until they graduate from college, and hopefully they will have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds for fattening

loans.name: Bwijenje Twetungure, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
With his small savings from his previous retail shop business, M. Denis, the married father of two at his age of 30, was able to start up his coffee trade business. He goes to farmers directly and makes purchases of raw coffee berries which he dries and takes to factories for resale. This earns him a clear profit of 150,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

Therefore, with this loan, Denis looks forward to collecting more stock for his store and expanding his business in the short run. Earning more revenue is his main motive because he will become financially stable and able to take care of his family and also live a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To restock his business with coffee berries from suppliers

loans.name: Rudy Luis

texts.es: El solicitante vive en casa familiar tiene un hijo menor de edad y su conyuge se encuentra en chincha, el solicitante se dedica como musico director del grupo Calle 4, ademas estudia musica en las mañanas. El solicitante pide el credito para compra de instrumentos (organno musical)
texts.en:
Rudy lives at a relative’s house. He has a young son and his wife lives in Chincha. Rudy works as the music director of a group called “Calle 4”. He also studies music in the morning.

Rudy is requesting a loan to buy instruments (a musical organ).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a musical instrument

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy core ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung V., 35, is a professional hair dresser, making US$5 each day in the Takeo province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband, Ry Sok, makes approximately US$1 every day, growing rice. Ung V. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yntymak

texts.en:
Yntymak I. is a resident of Tup, a small town in the Isykul region with a population of 15,000 people. Yntymak is just eighteen years old and is engaged in cattle breeding. Two years ago, his uncle presented him with a calf on his birthday. After fattening, Yntymak resold that calf at a higher price and, since that moment, he has been breeding cattle. With the loan he wants to purchase a calf for fattening and resale to make some money. In the future, he wants to increase the number of cattle he has and he plans to go to university.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo M. A. is 45 years old. He lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. 

Ricardo is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Ricardo also works in agriculture. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Ricardo plans to use the loan to grow corn. His goal within the next five years is to have his own house. 

When he is not working, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Koch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people, who are located in Trapeang Chrey village, Kandal province. Mrs. Koch Y., aged 69, was selected as the group leader by its members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Koch Y. and her husband, Mr. Suos Hang, are farmers who own 1.50-hectares of land where they cultivate peanuts and rice. This couple does not have any children who live with them, because their children are married. Now they have two grandchildren living with them, who all both students.
In order to pay for the grandchildren's school fees, Mrs. Koch Y. decided to ask for a loan, and will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support her agricultural machine for cultivating peanuts and rice.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Very hard-working M. Patrick has been operating an agro-produce sales business, with his main product as bananas from Bihasha Rukungiri, for a period of more than seven years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of five children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed, however, as the business now is in diminishing returns, earning him 200,000 Ugandan shillings, in sharp contrast to the previous earnings due season changes.

Patrick is no exception herein in terms of doing business. What he is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying fertilizer and improving production of bananas and coffee, which he grows most. He has other income-generating activities like the sale of coffee. With the auspices of this loan, he will improve on business expansion and production through mulching the plantations. He hopes to improve his revenue and also make himself more able to meet his day today life family necessities.

loans.use: To purchase mulches and fertilizer for plantation input

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en: Bazarragchaa B. is a 43-year-old single parent who lives with her daughter and her sibling in the province of Uvs in Mongolia. She and her daughter live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter, age 14, attends local secondary school. Bazarragchaa started her own business in 2000 by exporting a variety of clothes in the city of Tuba in Russia. Currently she works as a translator with Russian small and medium entrepreneurs. During the spring and autumn, she sells sea-buckthorn seedlings, imported from Russia, in the province of Selenge. Her current working capital exceeds 5,000,000 MNT, and she is planning to plant sea-buckthorn in her own two-hectare field in the future. Her dream is to provide higher education for her only daughter so that she will be able to live a decent life. Bazarragchaa is a very open-minded and talkative woman, and she is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more sea-buckthorn seedlings to sell for profit.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings of sea-buckthorn

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa B. is a 30-year-old single man who lives with his mother and brothers and sisters in the Songinohairhan district of UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His mother is retired and two of his siblings currently work in a private company, while his two twin siblings both attend university. As the oldest son, Amarsanaa is head of the household and responsible for his entire family. 

Amarsanaa has been operating a dairy business with the help of his mother since 1995 and has built a stable and successful operation. He has 16 milk cows at his home that produce the milk he sells. On average, his cows can produce about 30 liters of milk per day. He sells each liter of milk for 700 MNT to the two grocery shops with which he has supply contracts. His future goal is to increase the number of his milk cows as well as to raise his income. Amarsanaa is a very honest and deliberate man who says, "For the future, I plan to expand my cow farm." He is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan to purchase hay to feed his cows.

loans.use: To purchase hay to feed his cows

loans.name: Maria Wangui

texts.en:
Maria has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 42 years old, married to Paul M., and they have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour during planting. Ndunyu Njeru is a well-known place that has very good climatic conditions, really favovrable for potatoes and when planted in time they yield good results, so this makes  Maria work harder. 

In future, Maria hopes to practice  large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour during planting

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin N., 31, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2009, she has been making and selling rice noodles. She is able to make about 2 USD of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes 3 USD per day. This couple has three children; one is employed and two are in school. Yin N. is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to reinvest in her business. She will also use a portion of the loan to finish construction.

loans.use: Invest in rice noodle business and finish construction

loans.name: Kourn

texts.en: Kourn R. is a rattan cupboard and bed maker. She is 35 and is a married mother with two children who are pupils in the local public school. Since 2006, Kourn R. and her husband have been selling their products in front of their house, which has located in Kompong Tom Province. The couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes the finished items door-to-door to sell across the province. They always take a week or two to sell their products this way. Kourn R. is now able to run her business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price. Kourn R. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more wood to make beds for selling.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture to sell

loans.name: Adriana Patricia Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Adriana. Tiene 54 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos aun están solteros y viven con ella. El marido es jubilado. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya un año  y está muy contenta porque en las reuniones ha hecho muy buenas amigas.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de la marca Avon y Yanbal  (productos de cosméticos, belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas) trabaja  todos los días de  la semana desde las 9am hasta las 14h00, ella enseña la revista anota los pedidos y luego realiza los pedidos a la empresa, recibe los productos en su casa y entrega los productos a sus clientas a quienes les da facilidades de pago, les cobra por semana o cada quince días. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y otros productos. Su meta es  poner su propio bazar.
texts.en:
Adriana, 54, is a member of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank which meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Adriana is married and has three adult children.  Two of them are still single and live with her.  Her husband is retired.  She’s been in the communal bank for a year and is very happy because she’s made good friends at the meetings.

She is a merchant.  She sells Avon and Yanbal brand products (cosmetics, beauty supplies, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day of the week from 9am until 2pm.  She shows the catalogue and takes down orders which she then places with the firm.  She receives the products at home and delivers them to her customers to whom she provides easy payment plans.  She collects either weekly or bi-weekly.  She tells us that cosmetics are her best sellers.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and other products.  Her goal is to set up her own store.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and the father of four children. One of his children is attending university. He has been working in the agriculture field for the past 24 years. He sells agricultural products such as fertilizers and seeds. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his child. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his son's courses at the university. His son is studying Business Administration and is in his second year.

loans.use: To pay for his son's courses at the university

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa, 43 years old, is married and the father of two daughters and three sons. The family lives in Tulkarem in Palestine, where his wife is a nurse in a public hospital. Musa's shoulder was hurt badly during the first Intifada and has been trying to fix it since then. Musa decided to go to Jordan to receive treatment and came to FATEN to get a loan to help him cover the expenses.

loans.use: to cover his medical expenses in Jordan

loans.name: Mayflor

texts.en:
Mayflor M. is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She supports her family by operating a barbeque vending business. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her barbeque vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP15,000. 

Mayflor is  borrowing PHP 14,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Mayflor aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
"SANTA CATARINA" Este grupo esta conformado por 10 mujeres indigenas D. la poblacion D. Santa Catarina Mechoacan, Oaxaca, Mexico. Denominada Santa Catarina por la Virgen Santa Catarina ya que es la patrona D. la población. Mich-huacán: significa “Lugar D. Pescadores”; su etimología Michin = Pescado, hua = posesivo, Can = Lugar.  En mixteco se llama Nutiaca, que quiere decir “Pueblo D. Pescadores”; etimología Ñuhu = Pueblo, Tiaca = Pescado. Este grupo esta conformado por mujeres D. raza indigena muy trabajadoras. 
La representante D. este grupo es la señora Raquel C. H. D. 25 años D. edad casada con el señor Geraldo H. D. oficio campesino se dedica a la siembra D. maiz, frijol, etc; ambos tiene 3 hijos D. 6, 4 y 2 años, dos estudian el preescolar. La señorA Raquel se dedica a la venta D. calzado por catalago, D. igual manera venD. vestidos y bolsas.
Otra integrante D. este grupo es la señora Maria G. L. D. raza indigena D. 33 años D. edad esta casada con el señor Fabian H. quien se dedica  a la Agricultura el siembra maiz, frijol, calabaza, ajonjolí, jicama, etc; ambos tienen 3 hijos D. 9, 6 y 5 años D. edad los tres estudian.
La señora Maria se dedica a la elaboracion D. totopos (tortillas tostadas) hace D. diferentes tamaños: pequeños, medianos y grandes; los cuales pueden ser salados, simples y dulces con ajonjoli; ella aprendio a realizarlos ya que su mamá le enseño desD. pequeña y se ah venido heredando D. generacion en generacion, la señora Maria tiene que salir a la comunidad D. Jamiltepec que esta a 20 minutos D. su localidad para realizar sus ventas, ahi dias en que si se le termina pero ahi ocasiones en que le sobra un poco D. sus productos; D. igual manera en su casa venD., ahi ocasiones en que les llegan a ser pedidos D. otras comunidades.
La señora Maria solicito el prestamo para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para la venta D. sus productos.
Las ganancias que recibe D. la venta D. sus productos los utiliza para su familia en especial para sus hijos que estan estudiando ya que ella quiere que sus hijos estudien y tengan una carrera. Ella quisiera engrandecer  tener un local y poder vender otros productos aparte D. los totopos.
La integrantes D. este grupo agradecen a la fundacion y a todas las personas que hacen posible la realizacion D. los prestamos.
las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Alejandria L. G.: D. 56 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos y tostadas.
Cecilia Vasquez Hernnadez: D. 57 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. tostadas.
Leticia C. H.: D. 34 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la elaboracion D. tostadas para la venta.
Tomasa V. L.: D. 35 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. pollo y compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Cristina Q. Q.: D. 67 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Teresa S. O.: D. 34 años D. edad se dedica  a  la compra D. insumos para la elaboracion D. tostadas para la venta.
Maria G. L.: D. 33 años D. edad se dedica a la elaboracion D. tostadas para la venta.
Raquel C. H.: D. 25 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. zapatos para la venta.
Zoila S. D. O.: D. 55 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. hilos para la elaboracion D. servilletas para la venta.
Rosa Guadalupe H. R.: D. 50 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
texts.en:
"SANTA CATARINA” 

This group is maD. up of 10 indigenous women from Santa Catarina Mechoacan, Oaxaca, Mexico.  It’s called Santa Catarina after the Virgin of Santa Catarina who is the town’s patron saint.  Mich-huacán means: “Place of Fishermen.”  Its etymology: Michin=Fish, hua=possessive, Can=Place.  In Mixteco, it’s called Nutiaca, which means “Town of Fishermen;” etymology: Ñuhu=Town, Tiaca=Fish.  This group is maD. up of very hard working indigenous women.

The group’s representative is Mrs. Raquel C. Hernández, 25.  She’s married to Mr. Geraldo Hernández who is a farmer who grows corn, beans, etc.  They have three children who are 6, 4 and 2 years of age.  Two are in Preschool.  Raquel sells shoes via catalogue and also sells dresses and purses the same way.

Another group member is Mrs. María García López, 33, of indigenous race.  She is married to Mr. Fabian Hernández who is a farmer.  He grows corn, beans, squash, sesame, jicama, etc.  They have three children who are 9, 6 and 5 years of age; all three are in school.

María is a totopo maker (fried tortilla chips).  She makes different sizes: small, medium and large, which can be salted, plain or sweet with sesame.  She learned how to make them from her mother who taught her when she was a little girl and it’s been passed down from generation to generation.
María has to go out to the community of Jamiltepec which is 20 minutes away from her location to do her sales.  Some days she sells out everything but sometimes some of her product is left over.  She also sells from home and occasionally she gets orders from other communities.
María asked for the loan to buy ingredients she needs for the sale of her products. She uses profits from her sales for her family, especially for her children who are studying because she wants them to study and have careers.  She’d like to grow and have a locale to be able to sell other products besides totopos.

The members of this group thank the Fundación and all the people who make the loans possible.

The members of the group are as follows:

Alejandria L. G., 56, who buys ingredients for tostadas and fast food. 
Cecilia Vasquez H., 57, who buys ingredients for tostadas.
Leticia C. H., 34,  who buys ingredients for tostadas. 
Tomasa V. L., 35, who buys chicken and ingredients for fast food.
Cristina Q. Q., 67, who buys ingredients for fast food.
Teresa S. O., 34, who buys ingredients for tostadas.
Maria G. L., 33, who makes tostadas to sell.
Raquel C. H., 25, who buys shoes to sell.
Zoila S. D. O., 55, who buys thread to make napkins to sell.
Rosa Guadalupe H. R., 50, who buys ingredients for fast food.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 42 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 5, 8 y 9 años D. edad, se dedica a la sastrería desD. hace un año, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. comida, ambos negocio fueron fundados por iniciativa propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina D. coser, ya que esta herramienta es la principal para realizar bien su trabajo, esta inversión le ayudara muchísimo pues podrá salir con todos los pedidos D. forma ágil. 
Doña María quiere fortalecer el negocio y garantizar trabajo a futuro, ganando clientes y ayudar a su familia, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Doña María is 42 years old and lives in San Miguel with her husband and three children (ages 5, 8, and 9). She has worked as a seamstress for a year. María previously sold food. She started both businesses through her own initiative.

María is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine, since this is the main piece of equipment she uses for her work. This investment will be a great help because she can proceed with completing all of her orders with relative ease.

Doña María wants to strengthen her business, guarantee a stream of work for the future, attract more customers, help her family, and see that her children complete their studies.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Fortunata Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Fortunata Silvia;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad; La socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años;  La socia  es médico y trabaja actualmente el MINSA (Ministerio de Salud); la socia tiene en su casa un consultorio médico, ella  trabaja en la provincia de Espinar, la socia desea implementar su consultorio y aumentar medicamentos, motivo por el cual ella invertirá el crédito otorgado mediante este medio en la compra de medicamentos de sus proveedores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra d medicamentos.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Fortunata Silvia is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, married, and has a 15 year old son. Fortunata is a doctor who currently works for MINSA (Ministry of Health). She has a medical clinic in her home and also works in the Province of Espinar. Fortunata wants to keep her clinic in operation and increase her inventory of medication. For this reason, she will invest her loan in the purchase of medicines from her distributors. The money she requested will be used to acquire these medicines.

Fortunata is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her clinic.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma P. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Wilma is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she sells ready to wear clothing, sandals and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Wilma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional t-shirt, blouses & underwears

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen N. earns a living by selling a few fresh fish in her village, Kompong Tom province. She has been involved in this career since 2000, making a profit of approximately $1.20 a day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a rice farmer as well as a fisherman, and he can earn about $2 in profit per day to share responsibility with Pen N. in covering the expenses of the family. They are blessed with four children, two of whom are single and working, while the other two are married and live in their own houses. 

Most of the family income depends on Pen's daughter’s job. She is a sewing worker who always goes to her workplace by hiring a taxi or walking, and it is a problem for her. To deal with this, Pen N. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a used motorbike which will be used by her daughter to ride to her job location.

loans.use: to buy her daughter a used motorbike to ride to her workplace

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is divorced and has six dependants. She is responsible for the general upkeep of the home.
Ama prepares kenkey (fermented corn dough) and serves it with fried fish at Abbina near Elmina. She also smokes some of the fish for resale. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of corn to store as prices continue to increase. This will enable her to produce kenkey in larger quantities. She will be reinvesting her business profit for further growth.

loans.use: to buy extra bags of corn to store.

loans.name: María Paula

texts.es: María Paula D. cincuenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida, ella posee una tienda en la que venD. productos alimenticios, ya se ha hecho D. mucha clientela la gente la visita porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, les da un servicio excelente y tiene los mejores precios del lugar, siempre está adelante D. la competencia para María la motivación es lo que determina lo que se quiere lograr, y ella está decidida a ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como cereales, granos básicos, bebidas, lácteos, embutidos golosinas entre otras cosas que le ayudaran a satisfacer la clientela. María es una mujer D. fe y confianza que trabajara día y noche para darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Paula is 54 years old and lives with her life partner.  She owns a store where she sells food products and has a lot of customers.  People visit her store because she always has what they need, she provides excellent customer service and she has the best prices around.  She is always ahead of the competition.  María believes that it is motivation that determines what you will achieve and she is determined to see her business grow.

María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy more merchandise such as cereals, basic grains, drinks, dairy products, cold cuts, candies and other products which will help her to satisfy her customers.  María is a woman who is confident that she will work day and night to proviD. her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy cereals, basic grains, drinks, dairy products, cold cuts and candies

loans.name: Irina

texts.es: Irina tiene una tienda en la ciudad Cartagena  donde vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 13 años; ella inicialmente estuvo vinculada a una empresa de seguridad donde prestaba sus servicios como vigilante y al quedar cesante, con sus propios recursos recurrió al emprendimiento de su tienda, a la que ha ido agregandole articulos de miscelanea, con la cual ha logrado ingresos para su hogar, porque con su disciplina ha reinvertido las utilidades y lo convirtió en el gran apoyo a su familia.  En su barrio es bien conocida por las amas de casa y muchas personas del sector,  que no cambian sus servicios aunque exista competencia y también le refieren muy buenos clientes.  Irina vende principalmente de contado y tiene crédito a un selecto grupo de compradores que  por su buen comportamiento de pago han logrado esta negociación. Este es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará, víveres en mayor volumen para ganarse los descuentos y poder vender a precios muy competitivos. Su éxito en esta inversión lo planea teniendo en cuenta su posicionamiento en el barrio donde habita con su familia y también funciona su “Tienda abastico”.
texts.en:
Irina has a shop in Cartegena where she lives with her partner and two children ages 5 and 13.  She used to work with a security business where she was a watch-guard and when she lost her job, started her business with her own resources.   She has been adding miscellaneous articles to it and has been able to earn an income for her home.  With discipline, she has reinvested the profits and turned (the shop) into a great support for her family.  She is well known in her neighborhood by the housewives and by many others in the area who stay with her and refer her customers even though there is a lot of competition.  Irina mostly sells by cash and gives credit to a select group of buyers who, because of their good payment history, have been able to negotiate this.

This is her first loan with Fundacicon Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy supplies on wholesale to earn some discounts and be able to sell at more competitive prices.  She plans to be successful with this investment and is aware of her position in her community, where she lives with her family, and also has her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Née en 1981 au Bénin, Brigitte est mariée à Pascal un secrétaire. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Brigitte et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Brigitte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Ayant fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire, Brigitte mène comme activité la vente des fruits (ananas, orange, coco, etc.) au Bénin. Brigitte  s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Brigitte  sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1981, Brigitte is married to Pascal, an administrative assistant. The couple has three children, who all attend school and still depend on them financially. Brigitte and her husband take care of the various family expenses together. Brigitte lives together with her husband and children.
After going to school up to high-school level, Brigitte is active as a fruit seller in Benin, selling pineapples, oranges, coconuts, etc. Brigitte gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. This is the second time that she is requesting funding from ALIDé in order to increase her business and to better satisfy demand from her customers. Her first loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Sundas' Group

texts.en:
Sundas is 24 years old and married with a nine-month old son. She gives him her full attention and takes care of him. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities.  

Her husband is an electrician by profession and provides electricity and electrical tool repairing services to his clients. Being an electrician, he needs to deal with electric current all the time but he is very much an expert and has a lot of experience in his profession. 

Sundas has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electricity repairing tools and a drill that will allow him to perform his work better and provide better repair services to his clients. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sundas is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband by improving his business.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and a drilling machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a social and industrious 40-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with four children, one of whom is in school.

Mary has been running a cafeteria for a year. She supplements her income from this venture by selling cereals. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy potatoes to fry into chips.

Mary’s dream is to own a company and to be a major distributor of cereals. To that end, she wants in the next five years to have opened up a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to fry into chips.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a single man, 27 years old, and a residence of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

He raises rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years.
 
Abel earns PHP 4,500 a month from this activity. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional rice variant seedlings, fertilizers and necessary farm pesticides in order to increase his production.

Abel has been a member of GDMPC for two years. He hopes to augment his production in the future and is plowing additional farm fields to work on. In so doing, he can obtain more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice variant seedlings, fertilizers and necessary farm pesticides.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
To earn a living, Josefina manages a general store in their village to help her husband generate income for her family. She is 38 years old and has four school-age children. Her husband is a farmer raising livestock and a rice crop. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy soft drinks, vegetables, beverages, breads, canned goods and kitchenware such as Tupperware to sell in her store. She will do her best to increase her income for her family's satisfaction, especially to complete her children's education someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, beverages, breads, canned goods and kitchenware to sell in her store

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción se formó un comité denominado San Juan, integrado por 18 mujeres de dicha ciudad. Ellas están en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con un objetivo en común, que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para cada una de ellas. Desean un desarrollarse no solo en el ámbito económico, sino también personal.
Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día luchan por el sustento de su familia. Desean un futuro mejor para sus hijos y de todos aquellos que de ellas dependen.
La señora Seferina se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como ser empanadas, sandwish y demás minutas. Ella comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre compran de ella sus productos. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar con los gastos de la casa y ayudar también a su familia. Le gustaría poder abrir un restaurante donde pueda deleitar a los clientes con sus comidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus alimentos, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Juan” was established in the city of Asunción and consists of 18 women. They are in their eighth loan cycle as part of the Program of Women Entrepreneurs with Fundación Paraguaya. The ladies have joined together with a common goal, to generate more income for each of their families. Not only do they want to grow financially, but also on a personal level. The members define themselves as hardworking and determined women who strive each day to sustain their families. They desire the best future for their children and their other dependents.

Sra. Serefina sells food such as empanadas, sandwiches, and other quick dishes. She says that she has a large number of customers who always buy her products. Thanks to her work, Serefina is able to help with the household expenses and those of her family. She would like to open a restaurant where her customers can delight in her food.

Ths loan she is requesting will be used to buy the necessary ingredients for preparing her dishes such as meat, condiments, vegetables, and other items. Serefina is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children. 
Anecito is providing motorela, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for  utilities for his service.
Anecito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anecito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for utilities for his service

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Try (pictured above), 48, is a construction worker. His wife, 39, stays at home and does housework. They have three children--one son and two daughters. Two are garment workers and the other is still young. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about fifteen kilometers away. 

Try is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Inocencia cuenta con 28 años de edad tiene dos hijos los cuales están cursando el preescolar Kevin de 4 año está en segundo de preescolar y yamileth esta en primer año, ella es casada su esposo se llama Rafael él trabaja en vender de agua purificada.

La Sra. Inocencia tiene un negocio de abarrotes, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de productos como son: aceite, refrescos, detergente, leche, huevos y ampliar su negocio.

A la Sra. Inocencia le gustaría hacer crecer su negocio ya que dice que así lo hará pero poco a poco ya que con su negocio ayuda económicamente con el gasto de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Inocencia is 28 years old and has two children who are in preschool. Four-year-old Kevin is in his second year of preschool and Yamileth is in her first year. Inocencia is married to her husband Rafael, who has a job selling purified water.

She has a business selling groceries. Inocencia will invest her loan in the purchase of products such as oil, soft drinks, detergent, milk, and eggs in order to expand her business.

Sra. Inocencia would like to grow her business and says that she plans to do it a little bit at a time. Her business allows her to help financially with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, soft drinks, detergent, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of t-shirts and blouses for resale. Guadalupe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of t-shirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a farmer. He works daily on his farm and has a strong desire to improve his crop production. He devotes himself full-time to maintaining his business. His wife is engaged in a hog-raising business in order to bring in additional income. They work hard in their efforts to lift their family out of poverty. 

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, Edwin is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 in order to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer to improve and increase his farm production. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. 

Edwin believes that through his patience in managing his business, he will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer to improve and increase his farm

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 44 years old and has eight children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past four years, she has run a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Corazon is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de venta de cosmeticos por catalogos, la socia trabaja tambien tejiendo diferentes chalecos, chompas, gorros, guantes, chalinas, para niños y adultos segun los pedidos que le hagan, la socia reparte sus catalogos le hacen los pedidos y una vez que llegan los productos ella los entrega  a los clientes y le pagan en dos partes. la socia tambien reliza estos tejidos bellos en los ratos libres que tiene. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de lanas, botones, hilos, y colonias, perfumes, rimels, labiales para tener en stock.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling cosmetics via catalogue; she also works knitting vests, sweaters, caps, gloves and shawls to order for children and adults.  She distributes her catalogues and orders are placed.   Once she receives the products she delivers them to her customers who pay her in two installments.  She also makes these lovely knitted items in her free time.  She’s asking for the loan to buy wool yarn, buttons, thread and cologne, perfume, eyeliner and lipstick to have in stock.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn, buttons, thread, cologne, perfume, eyeliner and lipstick to have in stock.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La señora Trinidad es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes  les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar de ropa y zapatos de invierno para las ventas que tiene en diferentes partes de la ciudad. Aparte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio también se dedica a la venta de contratos de gas natura para las casas, con estos ingresos a sacado adelante a sus hijos. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener más variedad de mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a single mother with three children in her care. She would like to provide for them as best she can. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying winter clothing and shoes for the sales stands she has in different parts of the city. Apart from the earnings she obtains from this business, she also works selling natural gas contracts for homes. With these sources of income, she has been able to help her children get ahead. 
 
She wants to improve her business and have a greater variety of merchandise to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy used clothing as merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mario Jeronimo

texts.es: Mario Jerónimo tiene 65 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de relojería. Desde hace mas de 20 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio este medio de vida porque anteriormente estaba en un taller y su amigo le enseño este negocio, fue con el paso de tiempo que Mario logro aprender y establecer su propio negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de baterías, repuestos, agujas, fajas, pin, aceites entre otros. El objetivo del préstamo es para mejorar sus ganancias y al mismo tiempo ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Mario Jerónimo is 65 years old and provides watch repair services.  He has been in this business for more than 20 years.  Mario started earning his living in this manner because he previously worked at a shop where a friend taught him this trade.  Once he learned the necessary skills after some time had passed, Mario established his own business.  

This loan will be used to buy batteries, spare parts, needles, belts, pins, oil, and other supplies.  His goal for obtaining this loan is to improve his earnings and expand his workshop at the same time.

loans.use: to buy batteries, spare parts, needles, belts, pins, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Hawanatu. She is married, and has three children, age 5, 8 and 15 years. 

In 2002, Hawanatu established her used bras, briefs and head dresses business. She began her business to assist her husband who is also in a similar business. She transacts business with women, selecting different types of women's wear. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of  5,000,000 SLL. 

Hawanatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now she requires a new loan in order to buy more bras, briefs and head dresses for her business. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Hawanatu plans to expand her business to the other areas in the town and support her husband build a dwelling house for their family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bras, briefs and head dresses for her business.

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 36 years old and married. She has 4 children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jumdah runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Jumdah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 46 years old, married to Ochieng, and they have four children. She has been a tailor for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 14,500.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD of Kes 10,000. She will use the funds to purchase clothing textiles and other sewing materials which she needs in her tailoring shop. She plans to use the anticipated profits to grow her business.

Her hope is to grow her business into a big store and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 20 years old, married to Joash, and they have five children. She has been in the fish selling business for two years with a monthly income KES. 20,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET LTD of KES. 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more fish for sale. She plans to repay the loan   with anticipated profit from the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of cooking oil, wheat flour, plates, cups and spoons.

loans.name: Adilman De Jesús

texts.es: Adilman de Jesús de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en este rubro y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad en su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de siembra está ubicado en una zona apta para el desarrollo y crecimiento  del cultivo, además está cerca de la localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas  lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Adilman es un hombre decidido y muy visionario su más grande reto es alcanzar el éxito,  en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital para la inversión en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes, herbicidas, insecticidas, herramienta, etc. Adilman es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, segura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizantes, herbicidas, insecticidas, herramienta

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been in the video library business for thirteen years, plus motorcycle transportation business as additional income.  He started these businesses to care for his family and pay school fees for his children. His dream is to own a renown electronic shop in town, despite being challenged by customers who don't pay him on time. Moses is requesting for a loan to buy television and radio speakers to sell.

loans.use: to buy television and radio speakers to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells all types of plastic home products ranging from buckets to plastic dishes. She has been in this line of work for about three years. She was working as an assistant for her sister in law before this and then decided to start her own operation. Her husband has been very supportive throughout the process.

She needs the loan in order to introduce new products to her line. She sees potential for sales in a variety of new items but does not have the money to invest in them. This business plays a major role in her household. It has allowed her to provide her 4 children with an education and humble home. She hopes that with these investments she can continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Introduce new products to her sales

loans.name: Tolumaanave Susana

texts.en: “I strongly value and cannot forget all that I've learned from SPBD.” That’s what Tolumaanave always says to her friends. She joined the program in April 2004. She is married with six children. Her husband works their plantation which they depend upon for food and income for the family. She grows long-term crops such as taro and bananas, which are sold in the Fugalei Market in town. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and planting materials.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides and planting materials to improve her taro farm

loans.name: The

texts.en: Mrs. The is 34 years old and her husband, Lam, who is a mason, is 33 years old. They have 2 sons and 1 daughter. Her eldest son stopped going to school to work for some body in order to earn money. Her middle son is a student who is got scholarship from the Mekong plus project. Her other son is also a student at the high school. They have 2000 square meters for cultivation. Within a year this field is cultivated by 2 rice crops and a sweet potato crop that are alternately each other. Their income is $10 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to invest for the field. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Investing for the sweet potato field.

loans.name: Amal
