texts.en: Amal Rakhaimov is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Amal has his own vineyard and 8 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy  orchard medicines and fertilizer. He plans to develop his vineyard and increase his yields.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines and fertilizer

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is married with 3 kids of 12, 14 and 16 years of age. Her husband is a salesman and she used to live off his salary too. However, when their kids started to grow so did their expenditure and there was not enough money. Claudia therefore decided to sell her kids old clothes, and when she saw that it was a good business idea she started to sell new and used clothes, and this is how her business started. She now only sells new clothes and specialzes in women's and kids' clothing. She is very hard-working and would like her business to grow to improve her family's quality of life.

Claudia would like a loan of $750 to buy more merchandise and to start selling men's clothes in order to obtain more clients and to earn more. She could therefore give her children a better education and a better life. She will repay the loan in 4 months. Her and her family thank you for your support so that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como vendedor y ella vivía del sueldo de su esposo pero como ellos fueron creciendo los gastos también y no les alcanzaba por ello decidió vender la ropa que dejaban sus hijos, empezando así a vender ropa usada y vio que era un buen negocio y así fue como comenzó con su negocio, poco a poco fue vendiendo poca ropa nueva y actualmente ella solo vende ropa nueva y se especializó en ropa para damas y niños, ella desea hacer crecer su negocio y continuar mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Claudia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para surtir de más mercadería e incursionar en la venta de ropa para caballero y así ampliar su mercado y clientes, para mejorar sus ingresos y lograr brindarles a sus hijos educación y una mejor calidad de vida, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, y junto con su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is 28 years old and is engaged to get married. Nader supports himself and plans to support his future family with the income of his taxi driver occupation. Nevertheless, Nader needs a loan to help him start that new family he and his fiancée are planning to build. They will be living in the region of Borj El Barajneh. We wish them all the best.

loans.use: For his marriage expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue improving her product offerings and inventory

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: Ruth is a poultry farmer. She would like to use the business profits to buy more chicks thus expand her business and also pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Saman

texts.id:
The house where Ni Nyoman Saman lives is very simple and it is shared with other families. While the backyard is not big, Saman uses it to farm pigs as she wants to assist her husband in getting extra money to meet their daily needs. In 6 month, she can get a net proceed of IDR 1 million (approx USD 105). This proceed is used to assist the family needs and also to be saved. At the moment she needs additional capital to expand her pig farming by purchasing more piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Rumah tempat tinggal Ni Nyoman Saman sangat sederhana dan masih berkumpul dengan keluarga yang lain. Walaupun pekarangan tidak begitu luas, Saman tetap bahagia terutama semangat dalam membantu suami mencari nafkah. Terbukti 2 bibit babi yang dipelihara sangat gemuk karena Saman sangat rajin memberi makan dan menjaga kesehatan babinya. Selain memberi makan dedak padi dan dedak gandum, juga diberi makanan tambahan seperi batang pisang dan juga dedaunan. Saman senang bila tiba saatnya pelanggan babi datang untuk membeli babinya. Karena keuntungan yang diterima sangat membantu kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Dalam 6 bulan bisa meraup keuntungan Rp.1.000.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini akan digunakan untuk membantu suaminya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan hidup setiap hari dan juga ditabung. Saat ini Saman membutuhkan tambahan modal didalam usahanya untuk membeli bibit yang baru yang lebih banyak agar usaha ini bisa maju dan berkembang.

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli bibit babi)

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs Im S., 49, is a housewife and raises pigs, making on average $1.50 a day. Her husband supports the family by working as a logger, making about one dollar a day. The couple has seven children. Three children are married and live outside the family home; three others work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh earning $70 a month; the last child is a student.

The loan will be used to purchase more small pigs to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more small pigs to breed

loans.name: Zena's Hamasika Group

texts.en:
Zena is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 12 to 28 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 20, 22 and 72. Zena owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 1997. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Amina S., Eliza J. and Amina S., who have businesses dealing in hair salons and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Norbeta's Group

texts.en:
Norbeta is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, who are both 16 years old. Norbeta sells charcoal. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Anna and Helen, who have operate a cafe.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Iy Nak Long Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Iy Nak L. is the leader of a four-member business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a security guard, while the two others are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Iy Nak L. owns a small restaurant where she sells breakfast to the villagers. Because he business has improved, Mrs. Iy Nak L. now wants to expand her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more tables and chairs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tables and chairs for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Pauline Kose's Group

texts.en:
Pauline K. is the leader of a group of four women. She is 37 and divorced with four children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is 12. All of her children are in school. Pauline lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Pauline has been selling produce for the past eight years. She primarily sells tomatoes, bananas, and matoke (a green banana that is a staple part of the Ugandan diet). Her clients are mainly local people who shop for food for their families.

Pauline plans on using this loan to purchase more produce so she can be more competitive and increase profits. Additional profits will help Pauline pay the rent for her business, her residence, and the school fees for her children. She hopes to one day be able to send her children for a university level education.

Pauline has successfully paid back three loans to MCDT.

loans.use: Increase stock of produce

loans.name: Martha Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa is married and is a 39-year-old mother of 3 children. She has a farm in the Chiara district, about 2 hours from Ayacucho, where she raises cattle which produce milk. She makes cheese she sells in Ayacucho. She also works at cereal and root crop farming.

Marcelina is separated, is 55 and has 5 children. She has a store at her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. She travels to fairs twice a week where she sells clothes, fruit, vegetables, and groceries and she buys animals and cereals which she resells in her neighborhood.

Martha lives with her common-law husband and is a 28-year-old mother of 3 children. She has a car she uses as a taxi in Ayacucho, employing a driver. She travels to fairs where she sells fruit and buys cereals which she resells at the Nazarenas market.

Luisa, Marcelina and Martha belong to the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 600, 600, and 500 Nuevos Soles to buy rice and sugar but also for maintaining their houses and to buy a dairy cow. 

They dream about expanding their businesses, improving their houses, and having a dairy factory.

loans.use: purchasing rice and sugar, also maintaining their houses, and to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Năm 1997 chị Hậu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và được vay vốn vòng một với số tiền là 700.000 đồng. Với số tiền này  chị đã sử dụng để mua trứng vịt bán tại chợ và nhập hàng cho các quán ăn sáng  thu nhập hàng ngày cũng đủ chi tiêu trong gia đình. Những năm tiếp theo chị đều vay mức cao và buôn bán với số lượng lớn. Đến năm 2000 cùng với nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình anh chị  mua đất làm nhà tạm để xây lò ấp trứng vịt lộn. Nguồn hàng của chị  vừa bán ở chợ , vừa giao hàng cho các quán ăn , nhà hàng. Qua hơn 10 năm vay vốn và sử dụng rất hiệu quả  kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang có  2 máy ấp trứng vịt lộn và mỗi tuần xuất 40.000 quả trứng vịt lộn cho các quán ăn , nhà hàng , ngoài ra còn bán lẻ cho bà con trong thôn. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 19.000.000 để tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh trứng vịt lộn.
Thu nhập bình quân 8.000.000 đồng / tháng
texts.en:
In 1997, Ms. H. became a member of this organization and was able to obtain her first loan of $700.00usd. She used this money to invest in buying duck eggs, selling them at the local market and in bulk to restaurants. The profit made daily was just enough to cover her family expenses. The following years, she has been obtaining larger loans to increase the volume of her business. In 2000, she was able to use the money she made to purchase a piece of land to build ducks houses for nesting and laying eggs. Her inventory was enough to sell to the local market, eateries and restaurants. After 10 plus years of borrowing along with smart investment, she has seen a success and growth with her business. Presently, she has 2 egg warmers that produces 40.000 duck eggs a week, which she use to cater to eateries, restaurants and to the locals in her village. This next loan, she is requesting 19.000.000 in which she plans to use for her business. Her average income is 8.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr:
Née en 1973 à Ahépé, localité située à 47 km de la ville de Lomé, dame N. Caroline est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Son mari lui a aidé à s’installer pour vendre les céréales, les tubercules et les fruits depuis l’année 2000. Pour étendre son activité, elle a obtenu un premier crédit et a bien remboursé.
Elle aimerait refaire son stock de marchandise et sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de maïs, 200 tubercules d’igname, 10 paniers de manioc et 5 paniers d’oranges.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Ahépé, which is located 47 kilometers from the town of Lomé, Caroline N. is married and the mother of one child. Her husband helped her to start selling grain, yams and fruit in the year 2000. To expand her business, she obtained her first loan and repaid it completely. She would like to restock her merchandise and is requesting a second loan to purchase 7 sacks of corn, 200 yams, 10 baskets of cassava and 5 baskets of oranges.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain, fruit and yams

loans.name: Sokhna Diarra

texts.fr: Sokhna Diarra S. est une habitante du quartier ouakam à Dakar. Elle exerce le commerce de vétements depuis deux ans. Elle fait en moyenne un chiffre d'affaires de 15000 f cfa par jour. Elle est célibataire et méne bien sa vie. Elle veut un crédit pour renforcer son stock et préparer les fêtes de fin d'années.
texts.en:
Sokhna Diarra S. lives in the Ouakam district of Dakar. She has been selling clothing for two years. Her average daily turnover is 15,000 F CFA. She is single and has a sensible life-style. She wants a loan to boost her inventory so as to be prepared for the New Year holidays.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía tiene 58 años, es madre D. 9 hijos, ahora solo vive con 5 D. ellos, quienes la apoyan en el trabajo D. la agricultura. Su esposo se dedica a la chacra, siembra papa desD. hace muchos años y les va muy bien, esporádicamente ella prepara quesos y los lleva al mercado, pero hace un año le han pedido hilados D. lana y como tiene bastante lana D. carnero está  hilando mientras pastea su ganado, por kilo la venD. a S/.12 dependiendo del grosor del hilado, ella les venD. los artesanos D. San Pedro D. Cajas para que tejan las frazadas o tapices. Se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar el desayuno y  el almuerzo, su esposo se va a la chacra llevando su comida, desD. muy joven ha hilado y le agrada lo que realiza, le es rentable y está feliz D. hacerlo. Ya viene trabajando 4 préstamos con MFP, y ha sido puntual en sus pagos. El dinero será usado en al compra D. una máquina D. hilar para que pueda producir mucho más, el resto lo invertirá en abono para su chacra.
texts.en:
Sofia is 58 years old and mother of nine children, only five of which live with her now. Those that live with her assist her in farming their land. Her husband also works with them on their farm, cultivating potatoes; they have farmed for many years and it has gone very well for the family. Every now and then, she also makes cheese and takes it to sell in the market. A year ago, customers started to ask her for woolen yarn since she has plenty of wool from the animals on her farm. Now she makes the yard while she takes their livestock out to pasture; she sells it for ~$4/kilo depending on the thickness of the yarn. She sells it to the artisans of San Pedro D. Cajas who make it into blankets and tapistries. She gets up at 5 am to make breakfast and lunch for her family; her husband takes his food to the farm. Since she was young, she has spun yarn and she likes what she does. It is a profitable business and she is happy doing it. This is the fourth loan she has requested from MFP and she has been punctual in her payments. The money will be used to purchase a yarn spinning machine so she can produce more. The rest will be invested in fertilizer for their farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a yarn spinning machine and fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions and ginger to resell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is married and has two children. She supports her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  She has received a primary education. Her husband is a trader. 

Felicia sells a local meal popularly known as 'banku,' which is made out of corn.  She serves it with fried fish and hot sauce. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country.  She has been engaged in this business since 2003.  Additionally, she sells fabric at the Atabadzi bus stop in Elmina. Her loan will be used to purchase maize (which is used to prepare banku), fresh fish and other ingredients.  This will enable her to prepare more food to sell.  The profits from her business will combined with her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land on which to build their family house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make banku

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah M. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Deborah sells groceries and other food supplies at Kwadoegya near Cape Coast, which she has done since about 4 years ago. Her husband is a merchant.

Deborah uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Deborah will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Deborah plans to complete the family building she started with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua la señora Ana O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de alimentos y productos de especies como salsas, mostazas, entre otros ofertados en su propio establecimiento el cual ha logrado mejorar a raíz del tiempo.

Diariamente desde tempranas horas, la señora O. se prepara para abrir su local donde es visitada por varios clientes que compran los alimentos y las especies. El crédito que hoy en día solicita es para la compra de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de igual manera para la compra de las especies para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Managua, capital of Nicaragua, Señora Ana O. sells foods and condiments such as salsas, mustards, and others. These are sold from her own establishment where she has completed improvements on schedule. Every day, beginning early in the morning, Señora O. gets ready to open her shop, where various clients come to buy foods and condiments. The loan she is requesting today is to purchase raw materials to prepare the foods, as well as to buy the condiments to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Wassiatou

texts.fr:
OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou est née vers les années 1968et Résidente à Cotonou. OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou est veuve depuis plus de cinq ans et a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou vend les produits de beauté, les pâtes dentifrice dans l'un des marchés locaux du Bénin. Grâce à ses activités OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou arrive à satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou sollicite un deuxième prêt pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Wassiatou Ottekpola was born some time around 1968 and lives in Cotonou. She has been a widow for five years and has five children, all of whom are at school. Mrs. Ottekpola sells beauty products and toothpaste in one of Bénin’s local markets. Thanks to her business, Mrs. Ottekpola is able to provide for her own needs and those of her children. Mrs. Ottekpola is requesting a second loan to better respond to customer demand. In Bénin's local language, Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest.” Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to the most vulnerable and is part of a group that is about to launch a micro-health insurance program for beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and toothpaste

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Mrs. Thida C. is sixty-five years old and a widow with four children, three sons and one daughter. The daughter has full-time employment in a company in Phnom Penh. One of her children is autistic, one son assists his mother in her business, and the other one is in school. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Thida has been selling rice for ten years. She buys the rice from the market in Phnom Penh and resells it at the Chamkar Dong market. She earns a profit of about $37.50 a day. Thiday hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting her first loan of $400 to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn O. is 33 years old and married with 3 children. Two of her children are in primary school and the third is a newborn baby. She is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental and her husband is a carpenter.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March 2005 and is now on her 12th loan cycle, seeking Php20,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She will use it to buy stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items.

With her previous loans, she has demonstrated an outstanding loan repayment record. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to send their children to college to have a good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 años, trabaja con la finalidad de ayudar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar y forjarse un futuro prometedor. Desde los 20 años se dedicó a estudiar todo lo concerniente a instalaciones eléctricas, ya que es uno de los oficios que desempeñan en su familia, y para ser parte de la empresa familiar se preparó y hace 3 años ha empezado a instalar alarmas, lo que le agrada realizar, pues no es muy complicado, y en la mayoría de negocios solicitan estas instalaciones para su seguridad, haciendo este negocio rentable. Pilar tiene el anhelo de tener una empresa propia para gozar de los beneficios de este oficio, bajo estas metas está tratando, poco a poco, de independizarse y realizar instalaciones de manera particular. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, el ingreso a su grupo fue muy acogedor, propiciando en ella una gran alegría y confianza de trabajar en equipo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará materiales y herramientas adecuadas para desenvolverse en su oficio.
texts.en:
Pilar is 24 years old and works to help her mother with household expenses and to build her own future. Since she was 20 she has been studying all areas related to electrical installations, because she has family members who work in that area. To join the family business she learned how to install alarms, and started doing that work three years ago. She enjoys the work because it is not very complicated and most businesses want alarm installations for their protection, so it is a profitable business. Pilar would like to have her own business in this line of work, so she is working, little by little, to build up her independence and do installations on her own. This is her first loan with MFP. Her entry into the group was very pleasant, bringing her happiness and confidence to be working as a team. With the 1,000 PEN she is requesting she will buy materials and tools that she needs to do her work.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Señora María Elena M. tiene 60 años, su estado civil es casada. María tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Inicio por medio de una amiga quien le enseño a salir adelante, esto le ayudo a María a ser una persona luchadora, además cabe resaltar, que con la edad que posee no le impide tener ese amino de alegría para servirle a sus clientes. El destino de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos, pan, café, golosinas y refrescos naturales. El sueño de María es que su pequeño negocio se mantenga por que es por medio de este trabajo que ella sobrevive.
texts.en:
Maria Elena M. is 60 years old, and is married. Maria has 4 children and they all work independently. She owns a small grocery store; for over 9 years she has dedicated herself to this humble activity. She began this business by means of a friend who taught her how to get head economically, this helped Maria become a fighter; it’s also worth mentioning that even her age does not hinder her from having the spirit to serve her clients happily. This loan will be used as work capital to purchase basic grains, bread, coffee, sweets, and natural drinks. Maria’s dream is that her small business continues running because this work is how she survives.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es: El Joven Carlos Emilio R. Cadenas tiene 29 años de edad. Es un hombre soltero. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. La actividad económica de Carlos es brindar el servicio de auto lavado. Primeramente Carlos se dedicaba a lavar furgones, en lo que trabajo por mucho tiempo aquí tenía que aguantar sol y el inmenso calor estas condiciones no hicieron que Carlos perdiera su entusiasmo, por lo que más tarde debido a un cambio en la administración de su lugar de trabajo fue entonces que se quedo sin trabajo, por lo que decidió establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda al inicio no tenia muchos clientes pero por el buen servicio de Carlos tiene muchos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de aspiradora, barriles para almacenar agua y toallas. El sueño de Carlos es que su negocio obtenga las mejoras necesarias para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos Emilio R. Cadenas is 29 years old. He is the single father of one school-age son. Carlos runs a car wash. He used to work washing vans, spending many hours enduring the sun and the heat. These conditions did not dampen Carlos' enthusiasm, and later on he lost his job due to a change in administration. He then decided to start his own business in his home. He started off with few clients but now has many thanks to his good service. Carlos' goal is that his business improves enough to fully serve his customers. This loan will contribute to the purchase of a vacuum, towels, and barrels for storing water.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies for his car wash business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina trabaja de cocinera en una pensión donde percibe un sueldo mensual y por las tardes confecciona polleras. Así logra sus ingresos con que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos; ella es madre soltera, vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona de German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima – telas - para elaborar mayor cantidad de polleras para damas.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristina works as a cook in a guesthouse where she receives a monthly salary, and in the afternoons she makes skirts. This is how she earns her income, which she uses to cover the cost of supporting her four children. She is a single mother and lives in a rental located in the German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima zone of El Alto.

She will use the loan for the purchase of raw material – fabrics – to make more women’s skirts.

This is her second loan with Impro. The good payment behavior that she demonstrated with our institution qualifies her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for her business making "polleras" (skirts for rural women)

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en: M. Patrick is the leader of Nyamuhanamu group in Mubende. He is 37 years old and married with five children aged from four to twelve years, as he cares for three dependents. Since 1999 he has had a business selling alcohol in Nyamuhanamu, and he is able to make a monthly profit of 100,000 UGX. Patrick has future plans of building a family house and a house for rent so that he can have two businesses at the same time. He needs a loan to help buy and sell more alcohol for more profit. He says that the key to his success is his good customer care.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol for resale

loans.name: Emélido

texts.es:
Emélido O. Espinoza es un señor de 70 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y su sobrino,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Desde hace ya varios años don Emélido se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 
Don Emélido considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y ha logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad, la cual se ve frecuentemente azotada por las inclemencias del tiempo y el desempleo.

Actualmente don Emélido desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar tres vacas y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Emélido es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Emélido O. Espinoza is 70 years old and lives with his wife and nephew in a small rural community in the Alajuela province of Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala. They raise cattle for their meat and milk and plant basic crops such as rice, bean, and corn, among others. Emélido has been raising cattle for many years. He sells his products to nearby communities and his customers are very satisfied with the quality of products he sells. If fact, the demand for his products outweighs the supply he is able to provide. Don Emélido is thankful to the for the opportunities the microfinance organization has given him. Little by little his family has been able to improve their quality of life. They have been able to play an integral part in the development of the community, which has gone through frequent periods of inclemency and unemployment. Don Emélido would like to obtain a loan for ¢685,000 (six hundred eighty-five thousand colones) so that he can purchase three cows to increase his production. He knows that raising three extra cattle will require a lot of sacrifices and extra work. However, his goal is to be an outstanding small business owner and he is motivated to get ahead and improve his family's quality of life. Don Emélido is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, one of 100 organizations which make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and with the loan he hopes to continue to grow on a personal and economic level and to become more active in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase three cows.

loans.name: Yarleny Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Yarleny Concepcion G. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de realizar dicha actividad, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superacion.
en estos momentos esta vendiendo poco ya que no tiene dinero para comprar mas materia prima para tener una mayor produccion. ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leña, costales de harina de maiz, cal, agua. 
Yarleny no puede cubrir o cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes, ella vende su producto en pulperias, mercaditos y por encargos. 
ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar a producir tortillas, hace dos producciones al dia.
nos comentos que su sueño es comprar una maquina para elaborar tortillas y asi poder vender mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yarleny Concepcion G. makes and sells tortillas, which she has done for several years. She is a hard-working person with a strong desire to overcome challenges.

Right now, she is selling few tortillas, and doesn't have money to buy raw materials to be able to increase her production. She is requesting a loan to buy more firewood, bags of corn flour, lime, and water. Yarleny can not meet all the needs of her customers. She sells her product in grocery stores, small markets, or by special order.

She gets up at 4 in the morning every day to start making tortillas. She makes them twice a day. She told us that her dream is to buy a machine to make tortillas, so that she can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime, salt, and bags of corn flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Estaurofila

texts.es: La señora Estaurofila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es una mujer Casada, tiene 52 años y 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con su familia.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Estaurofila, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 44-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. Jean has owned a shoe factory since 2004. He produces shoes. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase rubber material for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his productivity. The difference between his work and others work is that he has a low income.  When Jean first started his business, he had faced some financial problems. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and he had experience in trading. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase rubber material for his work.

loans.name: Barta

texts.en:
Barta N. makes a living selling groundnut paste, tomatoes and other items, and has applied for this loan to buy fresh cassava and maize to sell.  She is 30 years old and married to a policeman. They have four children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy fresh cassava and maize to sell

loans.name: Melik

texts.en:
Melik H. is 60 and lives in Kaghnut village in the Kapan area. He is married and has three sons. His wife works at a chemist's shop (pharmacy) as a pharmaceutist. All of Melik’s sons are employees and one of them lives in a separate house with his family.

Melik works as a brigade-leader in an organization where he repairs factory equipment. At the same time, he has land where he grows grain. During sowing and harvest time, working hours last about twelve hours a day. Also, because he hasn’t got his own agricultural equipment, he has to wait till the other farmers’ equipment is free in order to rent it.

So, Melik needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy a plough and separator to cut down his expenses and to use his time more rationally.

loans.use: To buy a plough and separator for his farm

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch V. is the director of a private school and earns a salary of $200 per month to manage his family’s living expenses. His wife is a teacher for a local public school (she appears in the picture). This couple has a young son who is not enrolled in school. Touch V. is experienced at raising animals, a skill he learned from his grandparents, who died of senility years ago. He now hopes to review his knowledge by requesting a Kiva loan of $1200 to build a medium-size stall where he will breed many animals. This will allow him to earn more income to ensure that his family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a stall where he will breed many animals

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina S. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Celerina is single and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Celerina owns and operates a business venture that raises crops. While it is not the only means by which revenue is generated, the business' main source of income is from the planting and harvesting of bananas for sale. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008 Celerina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This earlier loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Celerina is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Celerina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Karen Patricia

texts.es: Karen Patricia L. D. B., D. 25 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija. Karen posee un comedor y pupusería, negocio el cual le permite solventar junto a su compañero D. vida muchos D. los gastos del hogar. Esta es una D. las mayores razones por la cual Karen desea poder invertir más en su negocio. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo el cual le haga posible el comprar maíz, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, arroz, y así mismo bebidas frías y calientes. Es como a través D. esto ella espera mejorar sus ganancias, D. manera que tenga más que ofrecerle a su pequeña hija la cual esta próxima a iniciar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karen Patricia L. D. B. is 25 years old and lives in the Department of La Libertad with her husband and daughter. Karen manages a diner and pupuseria, which enables her to work with her husband in meeting several of their household expenses. For this reason, she wants to invest more into her business. She has requested a loan with which she will purchase corn, cheese, beans, pork, rice, and both hot and cold beverages. Karen hopes to improve her profits so that she can proviD. an education for her daughter, who begins school next year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, beans, pork, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle célibataire sans enfants mais a deux enfants de ses proches en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 10 fois de suite. Elle fait de la broderie de draps de lit qu'elle vend, elle vend également des chaussures. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge la santé et la nourriture des enfants qu'on lui a confiés.
texts.en:
Rose S. is a 40-year old woman, who is single and has no children of her own, but has two of her close relations' children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank for five years and has good borrowing experience in that she has had ten consecutive loans. She embroiders bed sheets which she sells, and she also sells shoes. Her income will allow her to take care of the children's health and food, a responsibility which has been entrusted to her.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Lendith Ibane

texts.es:
La Sra. Lendith Ibane, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 niña, que aun dependen de ella, la socia presenta Secundaria Completa.
Lendith, se dedica a la venta de panes y dulces,  lleva 05 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Lendith, como le dicen de cariño, poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día son clientes fijos en su puesto. 
Actualmente, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa, por el trabajo que realiza. Con su primer crédito de 500 Nuevos Soles, implemento más su peque panadería, comprando harina en sacos, azúcar y sal.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos como: harina, azúcar, sal y saborizantes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.
Lendith, agradece bastante, al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional y a otras mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante y ser empresarias.
texts.en:
Sra. Lendith Ibane is a member of the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 25 years old, single, and the mother of a daughter who is financially dependent on her. Lendith completed her high school education. She has been selling breads and sweets for the past five years from the central market in the district where she lives. Over time, Lendith began saving and becoming well-known among her customers. Today she has established customers who come to her vending location. Her business continues to this day and she is very proud of the work she has accomplished. With her first loan of 500 soles, she kept her small bakery in operation by purchasing sacks of flour, sugar, and salt. With her current loan of 1500 soles, Lendith will buy ingredients and supplies such as flour, sugar, salt, and flavorings. Part of the money will be used to acquire a new display case for exhibiting her products. Lendith is truly grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing unconditional support to her and other women who want to get ahead and become entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, supplies, and a display case

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: A. Yvette est née le 12 janvier 1973 à Pobè, mais habite depuis 11 ans à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin.  Mariée à BOCO Toussaint, un instituteur, Yvette est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Yvette n’a fait que l’école primaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Yvette vend des produits de beauté de façon ambulante. Yvette exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Yvette a déjà obtenu quelques crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Yvette sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Yvette A. was born on 12th January 1973 in Pobè, but has been living for the past 11 years in PK10 in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. Married to Toussaint BOCO, a primary school teacher, Yvette has three children, all of whom are at school and in her care. Yvette lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Yvette went to primary school only. In order to meet her needs, Yvette is an itinerant vendor, selling beauty products. She has been carrying out this activity for 13 years and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Yvette has already had several loans from ALIDé which she repaid without incident. She is applying for a new loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business; this will allow her to meet customer demand more easily and to make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: Ifeanyi owns a pharmacy where he sells medicines at retail prices. His business is very lucrative and he makes a considerable profit from it, which enables him to take good care of his family. He hopes to increase his business in the future but the major challenge is funds, which he hopes to overcome. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Ifeanyi is married with six children. He lives with his family in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni Sunta is currently in the business of selling maize flour and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock Irish potatoes to sell.  Poni is 47 years old and is a widow.  She has seven children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a maize flour store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima Del Rosario tiene 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos. Dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años, con una parte de productos, hoy en día compra una amplia variedad. Es importante mencionar que ella sale todos los días a ofrecer los productos a sus clientes y a enseñar los catálogos en donde sus clientes deciden lo que Fátima les llevara. Ella sueña con llegar a tener algún día un tramo en el mercado. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pintura de uñas, perfumes cremas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
42-year old Fátima Del Rosario has two children. She earns her living by buying and selling cosmetics. She began the business five years ago with just a few products but nowadays she has a wide range. Fátima goes out every day offering her customers the products and showing them the catalogs from which they decide what she can bring them. Her dream is to have a place in the market one day, and for this reason she is asking for a loan to buy nail polish, perfumes, creams and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four people who live in Preak Raing village in Kandal province. Mr. Samnang U. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. Mr. Samnang U. and his wife, Mrs. Yat Sou, own a general store in the local village and earn some income to support their family. Since their business is going well they want to expand, but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mr. Samnang U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries. This couple has two children. One of the children helps the parents and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Mrs. Phal Vay Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Meun Tumrong village in Takeo province are 16 people who are make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Phal V. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Phal V. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, hire laborers to grow the rice and buy some piglets to breed to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Vey Ham, is a construction worker and she supports three children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is enrolled in the local public school, and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire farming laborers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel R. is from the village of Linao East, Tuguegarao City. He is 37 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Samuel owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Verk

texts.en: Verk S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells coffee and food to her new and existing customers for a gross income of USD 25 per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Hipólita, tiene 43 años, está casada, tiene dos hijos (Mariluz de de 22 años y Yudith tiene 2 años) y viven en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es vender tarwi en el mercado de Calca los días sábados. Ella siembra y cosecha alimentos principales para el autoconsumo y también para el intercambio a menor medida para la venta. Ella también se dedica a la ganadería como por ejemplo a la crianza de vacas, gallinas, chanchos, etc. Algunos animales sirven para ayudar a la siembra y otros para la alimentación de la familia. Hipólita pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios ciclos que participa y le gusta que le incentiven a ahorrar. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar una vaca que cuesta aproximadamente 850 nuevos soles y el resto del prestamo para sus productos como tarwi.  

(En la fotografía la socia está acompañada de su hija Yudith).
texts.en:
Hipólita is 43 years old, married, and has two children (Mariuz, age 22 and Yudith, age 2). She lives in the community of Rayanniyoc in the district of Taray, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Hipólita’s main business activity is selling tarwi beans at the market in Calca on Saturdays. She also grows and harvests her own food for home consumption and also for bartering and selling. In addition, she raises livestock such as cows, chickens, pigs, etc. Some of the animals are used to help with farming, while the others are used to feed the family. Hipólita belongs to the Communal Bank “Villa Raynniyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She has already participated in several loan cycles and enjoys having the incentive to save. Hipólita needs a loan to buy a cow that costs approximately 850 PEN. (In the photograph, Hipólita is accompanied by her daughter Yudith.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man and has one child. He has more than 20 years of experience running a car repair shop and he is specialized in car body repair. He also supports his life income by working in car spare parts. From his business income, he was able over the years to generate enough income to cover his family's expenses. He is requesting to borrow $1,700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools for his work in addition of buying more spare parts for his business. This is his second loan from a Kiva partner and he has been reliable with his payments and paid in full several months early. And he was thankful for the loan and he is certain that the new loan will help him expand his business level even further.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his work in addition of buying more spare parts.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: A garment factory worker, Mrs. K., 25, is married with two children who are still young and attend school. K. has a life partner in her husband who runs a service as a local construction provider in the village. In the past, K. hired a taxi at a high price to travel to her work location. Koryass right now hopes to cut down this fee by requesting a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to commute to work. K. was not available when the photograph was taken so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Mujeres De Sacsuy Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por  María Juana S. U.  tiene 53 años vive en el caserío lo cux aldea sacsuy, tiene 5 hijos  y se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado en San Juan Sac. Y San Raymundo, , también hace venta de refacciones  en las tardes  los fines de semana, Gloria Esperanza  C. S.  de 25 años,  tiene 1 hijo y  se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado en la ciudad capital, en el trébol , además hace blusas  y los vende desde hace2 años,doña Marta Alicia Vargas S. de 33 años tiene 5 hijos y se dedica a la venta de leña y tiene una pequeña tienda, además tiene animales  domésticos  y los vende, ella es la líder de este grupo con este crédito que está solicitando quiere agrandar su tienda, poner a la venta nuevos productos porque sus clientes le están pidiendo mas cosas, además quiere comprar más leña para tener almacenada  así cuando viene la época en que el precio se eleva, ella puede tener un poco mas de ganancias, ella espera que fape le de la oportunidad de agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
A member of this group is María Juana S. U.. She is 53 and lives in the town of Lo Cux Aldea Sacsuy. She has 5 children, and makes a living by selling pieces of chicken in San Juan Sac. and San Raymundo. She also sells spare parts in the afternoons and on weekends. Gloria Esperanza C. S. is another member. She is 25, has 1 child, and sells pieces of chicken in the capital city. She also makes blouses. She has done these activities for 2 years. Doña Marta Alicia Vargas S. is 33 and has 5 children. She sells firewood and has a small store. She also has domestic animals that she sells. She is the leader of this group. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to expand her store. She will sell new products because her customers are asking her for more items. She also wants to buy more firewood to be better-stocked because the season is coming where the prices are higher. She can make more profit this way. She hopes that FAPE gives her the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena C.'s main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 50 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. Filomena has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) when she sells one of her animals. Filomena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family. He has owned a perfume and pocketbook shop in his town since 2003. His shop is well known because he always tries to offer the new brands to his local customers.  In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.  His brother is out of Lebanon so he is the one who is helping his father with the household expenses. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory selection. In the future, he wishes to continue expansion of his shop and he hopes that he will be able to open a new branch some day.

loans.use: To increase his inventory selection

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., age 60, is a widow who lives with her three grown children in the Kandal province. She prepares and sells fried bananas, typically making about US $2 of profit a day. She is also supported by her three children, who are garment factory workers. 

Bun S. would like to take out a loan of US $500 to reinvest in her fried banana business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to fry and sell

loans.name: Sonia Gertrudes

texts.pt:
Sônia Gertrudes M. nasceu na Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 12 anos de idade, vai a Escola. Fez 12ª classe não continuou porque queria prestar mais atenção ao seu filho. Vive na casa própria com seu filho e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para algumas despesas de casa.

Nunca saiu de Maputo sempre viveu com seus pais nesta cidade, tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Não possui nenhum empegado e consegue um lucro de cerca de 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de outros clientes da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açúcar, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seus produtos.

O seu sonho é de comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no transporte de seus produtos. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir outra casa que vai servir de aluguer para aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Sônia Gertrudes M. was born in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother with a 12-year-old son who goes to school.  Sônia finished twelfth grade but did not continue with school because she wanted to pay more attention to her son.  She lives in her own house with him and supports her mother by sending her some money for household expenses.

Sônia never left Maputo.  She always lived with her parents in this city.  She has her own business selling basic foods.  She has no employees and earns a profit of about 3,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through other customers of this institutions.  This is Sônia's second loan.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, oil and other items) to increase her inventory.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to help her transport her products.  Sônia is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to build a rental house, which will increase her family's income.

loans.use: Purchase products (rice, flour, sugar, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 31-year-old man, married to an enterprising wife, who is a hairdresser, and blessed with three children below the age of 10. They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. Stephen is a motorcycle driver. He has been in the transport sector for four years now, since he branched out from the agricultural sector. He is proud of the way his venture is faring, although he has the challenge of irregular customers due to seasonal changes. Stephen needs this loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila lives in Multan which is the fourth largest city of Pakistan and is known for its history and tombs.  She is married to K. S. who operates a spare parts business.  He sells spare parts for different vehicles from his shop which is located in the market.  People come to him to buy spare parts from him because of his reasonable prices and the wide range of spare parts that are available in his shop.
  
Shakila herself is a business woman, who operates a clothes sales business to supplement the income of her family.  She buys clothes from the wholesale markets in Multan and sells them to her local area clients at a good profit.  She has given birth to two sons.  Her sons are 9 and 5 years of age and have not started going to school yet. 

Shakila has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy spare parts for different vehicles in order to fulfil the needs of his clients on a timely basis.  She is confident that her husband’s business will grow further by investing a loan into it.  She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shakila.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of spare parts to resell

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maritza de 45 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor Luis Alberto de 16 años y el menor Eyner de 8 añitos que sale en la foto con ella, labora para el MINED desde hace 16 años como docente. 

Esta solicitando su 10mo credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de su casa haciendo el porche, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 

Expresa que gracias a los creditos financiados por AFODENIC ha ido mejorando poco a poco su vivienda y agradece el apoyo brindado por kiva.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45 years old, single and has two children.  Her eldest, Luis Alberto, is 16 and her youngest, Eyner (who appears in the photo with her) is 8.  She has worked as a teacher for the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education for 16 years.

Maritza is requesting her 10th loan so that she can finish building her house, adding a porch, so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

Maritza expresses her thanks to her previous loans from AFODENIC which have helped her to gradually improve her home.  She is also grateful for the support provided by Kiva.

loans.use: To build a porch

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fabiana; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de artesanía elabora aretes, collares pulseras para distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez tiene su carreta donde vende todo tipo de golosinas como galletas, dulces, chocolates entre otros.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Fabiana belongs to the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Fabiana is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her handicrafts business.  She makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets which she distributes to her customers who request them.  She also has a small cart where she sells all kinds of sweet treats such as cookies, candies, chocolate, etc.

Fabiana is requesting this loan to keep both her businesses running.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep both her businesses running

loans.name: Shuja'

texts.en:
Shuja' is a young man from Jenin. He works in an engineering company. Shuja, his brothers and his father share in taking care of the family and house expenses.

Shuja's father has a car maintenance workshop. HIs father had to borrow money from relatives to improve the workshop, paint the walls and replace some of the old tools he uses. Shuja' took a loan from FATEN to pay back his father's debt.

Shuja' appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: Car workshop improvement

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a 24-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Amlan in the province of Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9000 PHP.

Michelle is borrowing 15,000 PHP in order to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Michelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 45 years old and a single-mother of one. For a living, she sells fruit. Mercy has been in the business for about eleven years. She was previously employed in a petrol station. She opted to go into business so as to meet her needs comfortably. Through Faulu Kenya, Mercy has managed to educate her daughter and improve her business. She hopes to relocate her business to the town centre in the future. With 40,000 KES, she will buy mangoes, avocados and watermelons.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, avocados and watermelons

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 43-year-old man, a husband and the father of four daughters and three sons. Jamal has a bakery in Hebron city. He makes all kinds of local sweets and desserts.

Jamal, who is photographed in FATEN's branch in Hebron, moved to a new house recently. He bought as much furniture as he could cover. He needed $3000 to purchase the rest of the needed items such as kitchen tools, chairs and tables. Jamal took out a loan from FATEN.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
Heydi es una joven de 28 años de edad, habita con su mama a quien aprecia mucjo y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, la Joven es una persona responsable muy trabajdora y con buenas recomendaciones tanto laborales como personales; labora como secretaria de COOTRAPRICA desde hace 4 años.  

Solicita su primer crèdito, para utilizarlo  en  compra de materiales de construcciòn para terminar de construir una habitaciòn en casa de su mamà  y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones.  

Su proposito principal es que su familia cuente con las condiciones nesesarias para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Heydi is a young woman of 28. She lives with her mother whom she loves very much and whom she helps paying for family expenses. She is a very responsible and hardworking young woman, and she has received good recommendations both in the personal and professional fields. She has been working as a secretary at COOTRAPRICA* for 4 years.

This is the first loan she is requesting, and she will use it to buy construction materials to finish building a room in her mother’s house to improve their living conditions.

Her main wish is for her family to have what is necessary to live in decent conditions.

<cite>*COOTRAPRICA (or Cooperativa de Transporte Rigoberto Cabezas) is a Nicaraguan co-op located in the town of Nueva Guinea.</cite>

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an extra room in her mother's house.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhon B. (pictured), 44, is a widow with four sons. One is married and other works for a plywood factory. They are living along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chhon works in the plywood factory along with her sons. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: 28-year-old Fidel farms for a living. He tills his own land in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for six years and sells his harvest to his community. Fidel works hard so he can send his two children to school. Fidel is also a married man. He hopes for his business to grow, which would give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Eyddy Geraldina

texts.es: Eyddy Geraldina B. A. de 33 años de edad, reside en casa propia en el Municipio de Cojutepeque del Departamento de Cuscatlán. Doña Eyddy posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una sala de belleza en la cual ha trabajado duramente para poder tener lo necesario y a la vez se ha especializado para brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Últimamente ha notado un fuerte aumento en la demanda de sus productos y de sus servicios esto la ha puesto en que pensar ya que sabe que entre más clientes solicites sus productos necesita tener más equipada su sala de belleza para no decepcionarlos. Esto  la ha  hecho tomar una decisión bien importante. Solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita ampliar su negocio y comprar más artículos de belleza como: shampoos, cremas para el cabello, cremas para el cuerpo, maquillaje, tintes para el cabello, esmaltes, y demás materiales atractivos para los clientes. Con la confianza que de esta forma logrará aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eyddy Geraldina B. A. is 33 years old. She lives in her own house in the municipality of Cojutepeque, in the department of Cuscatlán. Eyddy has a small business: a beauty salon in which she has worked hard so that she can have what she needs. She has also specialized in providing the best possible service to her customers. Recently, she has noticed a strong increase in demand for her products and services, which has led her to think that she needs to equip her beauty salon better, because more customers will require more products, and she does not want to disappoint them. This led her to make a very important decision: to request this loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to expand her business and buy more beauty articles such as shampoos, hair creams, body creams, makeup, hair coloring, nail polish and other items that are attractive to her customers. She is confident that in this way she will be able to increase her sales and thus her earnings, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as shampoos, hair creams, body creams, makeup, hair coloring, nail polish and other items her customers like.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Honyllette

texts.en:
Honyllette is 24 years old and married with one child. Her husband works as a farmer. They are living harmoniously in Gappal Cauayan City, Isabela, Philippines. 

To assist her husband earn their living, Honyllette operates a general store where she offers different products. She has been in this business for five years already and usually earns 5,000 PHP per month. To further develop her business, Honyllette is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, fruits and vegetables. In the future, she would like to continue taking loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Muniru

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Miniru.  He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 2. In 2005, Miniru established his provisions business. He began his business because he wanted to have more income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, he earns about $210 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Miniru requires a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, margarine, an additional carton of sweets, a carton of Tiger batteries, a carton of Bama mayonnaise and a carton of cheese. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately $47. In the future, Miniru plans to get a bigger shop and to educate his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, margarine, sweets, batteries, mayonnaise and cheese.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una clienta de  30 años de edad, vive con su novio  y  3 hijos, en casa propia ubicada en e distrito Las Lomas de Piura. Josefa vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y sólo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica. Josefa tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
